verse.content: Praise to Allah who cast his Word to mankind as Nasr for them, to bring them out of darkness into the light even though the ignorant hate it.
Surely Issa is the Word of Allah from eternity that has become flesh and we saw his glory.
Allah is too exalted to be seen by eyes, but the Word through whom everything was created is the secret of Allah made manifest.
The Word came to his people but some of them disbelieved.
But those who believed are the companions of Allah and they are the ones who receive Nasr.
Surely the prophets have come to you with the Sharia by which you are guided.
But Issa is the grace of Allah and the truth to a people who will believe.
Here is the account of the worship of Zakariya who was a descend­ant of Harun.
He lived with his wife Ashba near Bayt el-Maqdis and they were God-fearing.
But they did not have a son because she was barren and her husband was very old.
As he was serving his Lord as a Priest, they chose him to enter the Mihrab and burn incense.
While the people were in the courtyard praying, an angel was sent down to him in the Mihrab and he was frightened as he saw him appear.

He called to him, Do not be frightened, Zakariya, for your Lord is the hearer of your prayer. He will give you two a child whose name is Yahya. He will be the joy of your eye and at his birth all will rejoice.
He will be great before his Lord and will not drink wine but will be filled with the Spirit of Allah from when he is in his mother's womb.

He will lead back those from Bani Israel who have gone astray from their God, and in the power of Elias go before the face of Allah, to return the hearts of the fathers to the sons, those who have gone astray back to the wisdom of those who have been guided and prepare for his Lord worshipers who are seeking him.
He said, How can I have a child when I am so old and my wife is old and barren?
He said, I am Jibril, Allah’s messenger to you, bringing you the good news of Yahya. But because you have doubted this word, you will be silent for a time.

The people waiting outside were surprised at his delaying in the Mihrab, but when he came out they knew that something had been revealed to him as he began to motion to them with his hands without speaking.

When he returned to his family his wife conceived and she withdrew to her house for five months saying, Praise to Allah who has restored me by wiping out, the disgrace before the people that has lasted for years.
When she reached her sixth month, Allah sent Jibril to Mariam the virgin in Nasira of Jalil who was engaged to Yusif the carpenter from the family of Dawud.
He said, Salam alaykum, O you to whom Allah has been gracious. Your Lord is with you. Blessed are you among the women of the world.
Mariam was frightened and wondered at what this greeting could mean.

He said, Do not be afraid, for you have found favor with Allah. He will give you a child whose name is Issa. He will be eminent in both this world and in the next and they will call him the Son of the Highest.
Allah will give to him the throne of his ancestor Dawud as king over his people forever and his reign will not end as other king's do.
She said, How can I have a child when no man has touched me? He said, By the Spirit of Allah you will conceive your child and he will be sinless.
Your relative Ashba who was old and barren is now in her sixth month of pregnancy, for Allah can do anything.
Mariam said, Let his will be done and count me among the witnesses.
Then she turned her face toward Bayt el-Maqdis and entered the house of Zakariya and spoke a peaceful greeting.
When Ashba heard her greeting she was ecstatic in the Spirit of Allah and the child inside her moved with joy.
She cried out saying, Blessed are you among the women of the world and blessed is the son you have been given.
Is it right that the mother of My Mawla come to me? Surely this is a great honor!
For when your greeting fell upon my ears the child shook with joy inside of me. You are blessed since you have believed that the promise of Allah is a true and certain.
Mariam then sang her response, Allahu Akbar! My spirit rejoices in Allah our faithful savior, for he has been merci­ful to me and made me hon­ored.
He is Allah, the Holy Almighty One , who has come to me with a sign for all the world. He is Most Gracious and Merciful to his servants who fear him.
He has displayed his power and scattered the proud. He has brought down the mighty ones from their thrones and raised the humble.
He has satisfied the hungry with his good things and left the rich losers. He has shown mercy to Bani Israel. This is Allah’s covenant with Ibrahim.
Labor pains came to Ashba and she gave birth to a son. Everyone around her knew that Allah had been merciful to her and they rejoiced about it.
When he reached his eighth day they circumcised him. They were about to name him Zakariya, the name of his father, but his mother refused, saying, You will name him Yahya.

They said, There is no one among your people that have we called thus. Then they motioned to his father, What do you call him? He asked them for a slate and wrote on it, His name is Yahya and they were amazed and bewildered.
Then his mouth opened and his tongue was loosened and he said, Allahu Akbar! to their surprise and terror.
The people of the village began to speak of it, asking one another, What will this child who is strengthened by Allah become?
Zakariya was filled with the Spirit of Allah and praised: Praise to him who has come to his people as a redeemer and extended Nasr to us with a firm grasp in the family of his serv­ant Dawud.
As He promised before by the mouth of his prophets, there would be Nasr from our enemies as a fulfillment to his covenant and as mercy to our forefathers.
The oath which he made to Ibrahim was to give us Nasr over our enemies so that we could serve him piously, forever without fear.
And you, OO child, will be called a prophet of the Most High. You will go before the Mawla to prepare a path for him and to teach his people that Nasr is the forgiveness of indwelling sin.
This is the mercy of your Lord to those in the shadow of death and is peace like a sunrise upon those who are guided.
Yahya grew up in the wilderness, becoming strong in the Spirit, until the day he brought his people the clear message.
When Yusif became aware of Mariam's pregnancy while he was not yet married to her, he wanted to send her away secretly so as not to disgrace her, for he was God-fearing.

But an angel came to him in a dream and said, O Yusif, what prohibits you from taking your fiancée to your house? She has conceived by the Spirit of Allah and will give birth to a son whom you will name Issa, for he will be the Nasr to his people from the sins they commit.
It is the sure promise in the Tawrat, The virgin will be given a son, for your Lord is Near and the Answerer.
When Yusif awoke from his sleep he brought Mariam to his house, but did not touch her until she had given birth to her protected first-born.

At that time Caesar Augustus decreed that all citizens should be counted, each person going to the place of his birth for the census. Yusif went with Mariam, who was pregnant, from Nasira to Bayt Lahm to be registered in the town of his forefathers.
There she gave birth and wrapped him up, and since there was no room for them in the guest house, she laid him in a manger. They named him Issa as they were command­ed by Jibril.
As shepherds were guarding their flocks in the fields of the village by night, an angel appeared to them and Allah sent down his light on them and they were afraid and puzzled.

The angel said, Do not be afraid! I have come with great news about which you will rejoice. Your Nasir is born today in the city of Dawud as a child, swaddled and in a Manger lying. He is the sign, el-Masih, your Mawla by whom you receive Nasr.
Then there appeared with him a group of angels wor­shiping: Praise to Allah in the highest, on earth peace, and joy among the people.
When the angels disappeared from their eyes the shepherds said, Come, let us go to Bayt Lahm, for surely, to the sign of our Lord which we were told the good news of, we are being guided.
They saw Mariam and Yusif and the child lying in the manger and they told of the event of the angel and his good news and rejoiced.
Those who told the good news of this great event were amazed. Mariam kept secret what she heard, for she was a meditator.
Then the shepherds returned, and they were praising for what they saw, heard and were told.
When the child reached his eighth day they circumcised him and called him Issa, just as the angel had called him before the virgin conceived.
Then they carried him to the House of Allah to offer the sacrifice of a pair of doves for every first-born as Musa had commanded them and they were dedicating.
There was in the city a God-fearing man who was lead by the Spirit of Allah to expect the Nasr of his people. It was revealed to him that he would not die until he had seen the Nasr of Allah appear.
He came to the House of Allah and saw Mariam and Yusif carrying the child to offer his sacri­fice. Siman then took the child in his arms and worshiped Allah the Gener­ous.
He said, Lord, your promise has been fulfilled for me! Let your servant go satisfied in peace.
With my very own eyes I have seen your Nasr which you have sent to all people.
He will be glory to Bani Israel, your people, and guidance, light and a sermon to all the world.
Yusif and Mariam were amazed at what they heard. Siman blessed them and said to Mariam, Allah has chosen your child to be the downfall of many among Bani Israel and the rising of others.
He is the sign of Allah that they will disbelieve in and that will reveal what they are hiding.
But for you, O Mariam, a sword of sorrow will pierce your heart and you will mourn.
Relate in the book Hannah the prophetess who became a widow and grew old and who was among the secluded ones.

She did not leave the House of Allah, worshiping Him with fasting and prayer night and day. When she saw that it was the hour for the sacrifice, she praised her Lord and prophesied of the child Issa to those who were awaiting the redemption of the House.

When Issa was born during the reign of King Hirudus, Majus came to Bayt el-Maqdis from the East asking, Where is the one who has been born King of the Yahud?. We have seen his star rising in the east and have come to prostrate before him.
When the king heard this he was afraid and the city also. He then called to himself the religious teachers and asked them, Where is the promised Masih to be born?
They said, In Bayt Lahm, as the word of Allah in the Tawrat says, O Bayt Lahm, you are not the least of cities, for out of you will come an Amir who will shepherd Bani Israel.

So the King called the Majus to himself secret­ly and found out the time of the appear­ance of the star. Then he sent them to Bayt Lahm and said, Search for the child and when you find him, inform me so that I can come and bow down with the bowers.

As they were on the way, there appeared to them the star of the east that they had seen, going ahead of them until it reached the place of the child and then stood over him. When they saw the star they were glad and rejoiced.
They entered and found the child and his mother and fell down in prostration, presenting gifts to him of gold, incense and myrrh as offer­ings.
But Allah revealed to them in a dream not to return to the king so they traveled another way, leaving to their homes.

And there appeared to Yusif in a dream an angel who told him, Take the child and his mother and flee to Egypt and dwell in it until I give you permission. For the King wants to kill the child and he is determined.
So he took his family by night from the place of birth to Egypt and they lived there until the king died. The word of the Tawrat was thus fulfilled, Out of Egypt I have called the beloved.

When the King realized the trick the Majus had played on him he was inflamed with rage. He ordered the death of the children of the town who were two years old and young­er. This was the word of Allah in his glorious Book.
In the land was heard crying, wailing and lamenting. How can Rahil, who is bereaved of her chil­dren, continue to be patient?
An angel came to Yusif while he was in Egypt and said to him, The one who wanted to kill the child has died so return to Palestine.
As they were returning Yusif realized that the son of the king had inherited the throne of his father, so he passed around Bayt el-Maqdis in fear of the oppressors.
Allah revealed to him and he took refuge in Jalil and made Nasira a homeland for himself. The word of the prophets was thus fulfilled, A Nasiri they will call him.
Allah was gracious to Issa and strengthened him by His Spirit and he knew what others did not know.
When he was twelve years old he turned his face in the direction of Bayt el-Maqdis with his mother and Yusif to carry out a religious duty.
When Id el-Nahr was completed, Yusif and Mariam thought that the boy was returning with them but Issa stayed in Jerusalem.

After a distance of one day they missed him and searched for him among family and friends but could not find him. They returned to Bayt el-Maqdis and found him after three days in the House of Allah among the learned.
He was listening to the teachers, learning from them by both asking and responding. He amazed them as he was both clever and sharp.
When his mother saw him she was amazed and said, O my son, why have you done what you have done? You have worn us out for we were searching for you!
He replied, Why all this when it was necessary for me to be in the house of my Father! But his mother did not understand what he meant, but it had tremendous meaning.
They returned to Nasira and the boy lived in obedience to his mother and Yusif, and Mariam kept secret all this for she was among those that memorize.
Issa increased greatly in both knowledge and body and received the favor of both Allah and all people.

The account of the beginning of the good news of Issa through your Lord’s sending Yahya the son of Zakariya in the wilderness. He came to the Jordan River calling for the ghusl from Allah for those who repent.

This is the voice crying in the Tawrat to prepare the way for our Lord and make it straight. Raise every valley and lower every mountain. Straighten every curve and make smooth every rough place so that the people might see the mercy of Allah.
Yahya was wearing a robe made of camel's hair and girded himself with a leather belt. For food he ate locusts and honey and he was among the ascetics.
The people of Bayt el-Maqdis and the surrounding areas were hurrying to the river Jordan to be bap­tized, confessing their sins.
A group of faqihs came to Yahya to receive the Sibgha from Allah and confess their sins.
He said to them, O children of vipers, are you fleeing from the torture of the Fire?
Produce the fruit of repentance and do not depend on your saying, Surely Ibrahim is our father and we are in a secure position.
Allah is able to make from rocks children for Ibrahim.
Behold the ax is on the roots of the trees. The tree that is not fruitful will be cut down and cast into Hell.
A group of people asked him, What can we do to be repentant? Yahya said, Whoev­er has two robes, let him give one away and whoever has food share it with others.
Some tax collectors asked, How can we be just? Yahya said, What is allotted to you, take and do not be greedy.
A band of soldiers said, What can we do to be those that do good? Yahya answered, No injustice or slander, but instead be content with your pay.

The people were watching for the Nasr of Allah. They were asking among themselves if Yahya was the Mustafa Rasul. 14) Yahya said, I immerse[^1] you with water. But one who is stronger than I, whom I am not worthy to untie the laces of his shoes, will come and immerse you with the Spirit of Allah and you will be pure.
He will take his winnowing fork and purify his threshing floor. He will gather the wheat into his barn and throw the chaff into hell.
In this way Yahya came warning and bringing good news and the people were learning from him greatly.
A group of Priests came from Bayt el-Maqdis asking, Yahya, who are you? He answered, I am not the Owner of the Age whom you are waiting for.
They asked, Are you Elias who disappeared or the prophet which Musa spoke of? He said, No. They said, Make it clear so we can answer those who have sent us to you seeking information.
I am the voice crying in the wilderness, prepare a way of our Lord. This is what you read in the Tawrat.
They said, How do you immerse into water when you are not the Masih nor the prophet which Musa prophesied of, nor Elias?
He said, I immerse into water, but among yourselves is one who you do not know. He comes after me and is greater than I and I am not worthy to untie the laces of his shoes.
This is what happened across the Jordan where Yahya baptized those who came to him.

Then Issa came from Jalil to the river to receive Sibgha, but Yahya objected to him and said, You must not come to me but I should come to receive Sibgha at your hands. Issa said, But you must immerse me now so that the will of Allah may be a religious duty you perform.
Yahya responded to his request after all the people received Sibgha
Then Issa came up out of the water. The heavens opened for him and the Spirit of Allah descended on him as a gentle dove.
A voice came from heaven saying, This is The Beloved and We are very pleased with him!
When Issa began his message people called him the son of Yusif and he was thirty years old.

When he crossed the river, anointed with the Spirit of Allah, the Spirit lead him into the wilderness where he stayed with wild animals and angels served him. He fasted forty days, day and night. Hunger overtook him and Shaytan began to make sin seem right to him to turn him away from the path.

He said, If you have come from the Spirit of Allah, then command these stones to become bread. Issa replied with the word of truth from the Tawrat, A person does not live by bread alone but by the word of Allah he lives and exists.

Iblis then took him to the top edge of the House of Allah and said, If you have come from the Spirit of Allah, then throw yourself to the earth. For the Zabur says, Allah will put his angels in charge of you and you will not strike your foot on a stone with but they will be your protectors.
Issa answered with the word of the Tawrat, Do not test your Lord who Exalted and Great.
Then he took him up a high mountain and showed him the glory of the kingdoms of the world. He said, If you worship me and bow down before me, I will give you all this and you will be a ruler.
Issa said, I take refuge in Allah from Shaytan the accursed! Then he quoted to him the word from the wise account, Prostrate to Allah alone and do not be an idolater.
Iblis disappeared from his sight and left him and a group of angels came to serve him.
When Yahya saw him he said, This is the one who will redeem mankind with a mighty sacrifice!
He is the one who comes after me but he is greater than I because he was before me. I came immersing in water so that he would appear to Bani Israel.
I did not know him before, but Allah who sent me to immerse in water said, The one whom you see the Spirit remain upon is the one who will immerse with the Spirit.
Because I observed this with my eyes, I witness that Issa is the Masih of Allah whom you are expecting.

While Yahya was with two of his followers he saw Issa walking and told them, This is the sacrifice of Allah the Most High! The two left him and followed Issa. He asked them about their intention and they asked, Our Mawla, Where do you stay?
Issa answered them and they became his companions and the first Hawariyun.
Andri the Hawari met his brother and said, We have found the Nasr of Allah the Great!
The two went to Issa and he looked at him and said, You are the son of Yuna, but I will call you Safwan, the strong rock of Allah.
The next day, as Issa was on his way to Jalil, he encountered Philip of Bayt Saida, the town of Safwan and his broth­er. He said to him, Follow me in the way, and he became one of the followers.
Philip found his friend Ata and told him the news about Issa who was called the son of Yusif the Nasiri. He said, We have found the one spoken of by Musa in the Tawrat and by the prophets.
Ata considered the matter seriously and asked, Can the righteous come from Nasiri? But Philip called him to have a look at this certain news.
Issa saw him coming and said, This is a pure Israelite.

Ata was amazed and said, Our Mawla, you are the Masih of Allah and the Lord of our people! Issa said, Have you believed in me because I said I saw you under the fig tree? You will see greater things than you have seen after a while.
On that day the gates of heaven will open and you will see angels ascending and descending and in my service attending.

In Kafr Qana there was a wedding, and Issa, his mother and the Hawariyun were invited. When the wine ran out, his mother asked him for a sign that would serve the people. He said, O dear woman, not yet; why are you in a hurry?

There were in the house six jars for water, each one with a capacity of two or three measures. The people would purify themselves with the water from these jars. Mariam said to the servants, Carry out what you have been ordered.
Issa said, O servants, fill the jars with water. They filled them until they overflowed. He then said to them, Now draw from them and serve it starting with the leader of the people, O servers!
When he had tasted the wine that was previously water, he did not know how it was pre­pared. Only the servants who drew it knew.

He called to himself the owner of the house and said, People offer the good wine before the lesser and when the guest gets drunk, then they present the other. But you have delayed till now what is should have been offered first, not the way people usually do it!

This was Issa’s first miracle and he displayed his glory and it shown forth. His helpers increased in their faith and grew stronger. Then Issa went down to Kafr Nahum with his mother and his brothers and the Hawariyun.
When Id el-Nahr drew near, Issa made the Hajj to Bayt el-Maqdis. He found in the House of Allah sellers of cattle, sheep and doves and money changers at their tables sitting.

He made a whip from ropes and drove them all from the House of Allah and turned over their tables and said, Remove this from here! Will you turn the House of Allah into a place of commerce and a market?
The Hawariyun remembered the word of truth in the Zabur, Zeal for your house, O my God, truly consumes me.
A group of them said, If only you would do a miracle that would support you. He answered, Tear down this house and I will certain­ly raise it in three days.
They said, How can this be? This house was built in forty-six years!
But Issa meant the house of his body. When he rose from the dead the Hawariyun remem­bered his word and they increased their faith in the word of their Mawla and in the Book.
Many believed in him from Bayt el-Maqdis when he displayed to them his great signs.
Issa did not feel com­fortable with any one of them, for He was all-knowing of what they were hiding and what they revealed.

A fanatic came to him at night from among the faqihs who was called Thafir. He said, O teacher, we know that you are a messenger, for no one is given the signs you have been given unless he has come from Allah and was strengthened.
Issa said, Know that no one enters the Malakut of Allah except those that have been truly born.
The faqih was surprised and said, How can a person be renewed if he is old? He is not able to enter his mother's womb a second time and be born righteous.
Issa said, Whoever is not born by his mother and renewed by the Spirit of Allah can not enter the Umma of Allah at all.
For the one born by flesh is human but the one born by the Spirit is spirit. This is the certain truth.

Those that are born by the Spirit of Allah are like the wind. It blows from every direction. You hear its sound but you do not know its starting point or its resting point. When I tell you that it is necessary for you to be renewed by Allah, are you filled with surprise?
The Faqih said, How can this be? Issa said, O you who teach Bani Israel, do you not understand? I speak to you the truth and bear witness to what I have seen but you refuse it with doubt.
Behold, you are the ones who disbelieve the truth after it has come to you in parables from the world. Will you be­lieve if we come with the secrets of the heavens openly?
No one has made the Araj up to heaven except the one who came down from Allah and became human for you.
As Musa raised the bronze snake on a stick in the Sinai, in like manner I must be raised up and give my life and whoever trusts in me will live forever.
For Allah has sacrificed the Masih in love for man­kind, so that whoever believes in him will not perish but will have life forever.
For Allah did not send the Masih to make people suffer but as healing and Nasr for them.

He who trusts in him will not be condemned, and he who does not trust in him is condemned, because he has not trusted in the only Word of Word. He is the light that has risen on the world, but people have loved ignorance and despised the light as they continued to do evil.
Surely, sinners truly fear the light. They do not come out to the light because of their shame. But those who repent come out openly and show their faith in the truth.
Yahya, before he was impri­soned, was immersing people at Ayn Nun near the city of Baysan. Issa and the Hawariyun also began to immerse those who wanted Ghusl.
The followers of Yahya and the people were arguing over purification. They said, O teacher, the one you bore witness to at the river is immersing the people and they are hurrying to him with desire.

Yahya said, No one receives any­thing except from Allah. Behold, you are the ones who witness to what I said to you that I am not the Masih whom you are expecting. I am a messenger who comes before him as a helper.
Truly, I am like a friend of the bride­groom who supports him and helps him happily. Today my joy is complete in him. I will decrease but he will rise.

Whoever comes from the world speaks from, but whoever comes down from Allah is the most honorable of the messengers and the most exalted. He speaks what he has heard and seen from Allah and is filled with the Spirit of Allah . Whoever believes in him has made sure that the promise of Allah is true.

Allah loves his Word whom he has spoken and has placed in his hands the malakut[^2] of all things and strengthened him. Whoever believes in him will have Nasr but whoever does not believe will re­ceive wrath from Allah forever.

Yahya continued to call the people to the faith as a guide. But when he denounced King Antibas's marriage to Hirudya the wife of his brother, he threw him into prison unjustly. Issa heard about the matter and in cau­tion headed toward Jalil.
The faqihs were alarmed that the disciples of Issa were increasing and had even surpassed Yahya's. But Issa himself did not immerse[^3] the people but his helpers gave the people Ghusl.
He left Bayt el-Maqdis heading for Jalil and passed through Nablus, the land of Yaqub that he gave, with its well, to his son Yusif in love.
As his travels continued until late afternoon, he sat on the edge of the well. A woman of the Samiriyun came to draw water. He asked her, Give me some water, for he had become very thirsty.

She said, How, when a Yahudi does not ask water of a Samiriya and the Yahud have exalted themselves over our people in such a big way? At that time the helpers were in the city looking for food for themselves.
He said, If only you knew the gift of your Lord and who is asking you for water, you would have asked him and he would have given you the water of Nasr.
She said, How do you have that? The well is deep and you have no bucket! Are you greater than Yaqub the prophet who gave us this well and who, with his family and sheep, drank from its water always?
He said, Whoever drinks this water will become thirsty. But the water which I give will spring up as life in the one who drinks it and he will not thirst.
She said, O master, give me a drink from this water so that I will not thirst or draw water from here anymore.

He said, Go and call your husband and the two of you come here. She said, I have no husband. He said, You have spoken the truth, for you have no husband and the person you are with now is not your husband and you have been married five times before.
She said, I perceive that you are a prophet! Our fathers worshiped Allah on this mountain of Jabal Jirzim. But you Yahud consider Bayt el-Maqdis as the necessary qibla.

He said, O woman, trust me that the time is coming when you will not face this mountain as a qibla nor Bayt el-Maqdis. You worship whom you do not know but we worship Allah whom we have known. Mercy comes from us.
The time has come when the sincere worshipers will truly worship Allah through the Spirit. Those are the ones Allah seeks as worshippers.

For Allah is Spirit and has required of you worship through the Spirit that has no qibla. The Samiriya said, I know that the Mustafa Rasul will come and guide us rightly in all things. I am he who speaks to you, said Issa, revealing himself.
As he was in that situation, the Hawariyun re­turned and they were amazed as they saw him speaking with a female. But they did not ask him about that in embarrassment.

She left her jar and returned to her people. She said, O my people, come and see the one who revealed to me what I had done! Perhaps he is the expected Nasr of Allah. The people of the city came out to Issa.
The Hawariyun called him to some food but he said, I have good food, if only you knew.
They thought that someone had come to him with something to eat. He said, Surely my food is to walk in the path of Allah doing his will.
I am like the harvest that comes after four months from the planting. Behold I tell you, look at the fields for now the planting and the harvest are ripe.
The harvester is hired who gathers the fruit of Nasr for Allah. Thus the plant­er and the harvester rejoice together. One sows and the other reaps. The saying is true.
I have sent you to harvest that which you did not toil for. Others have toiled and you are harvest­ing their planting.
Many of the Samiriyun believed in him after the woman bore witness to him saying, He has revealed to me what I have done. They gave them hospitality and he remained and guided them two days .
They increased in faith and they said to the Samiriya, We certainly believed in him when you witnessed about him, but today we believe and witness that Issa has come to us from Allah as Nasr.
Issa went to Jalil though he knew that no honor is to be expected for a prophet in his own country.

As the people of Jalil witnessed his signs in Bayt el-Maqdis during the days of the feast, they were friendly to his party and he found among them a welcome. Then he came to Kafr Qana where he turned the water into wine.
There came to him from Kafr Nahum an official of the king begging him to come and heal his son for he was near to death.
Issa said, Why do you not believe unless I reveal to you signs and wonders?
He said, Hurry, my master, before death makes off with my son! Issa said, Go and may your son live. The man was reassured at his word and returned to where had come.
As he was on the way, his servants met him and told him the good news that his son had recov­ered. He asked, When?
They said, Yesterday at noon the fever left him. Then he remembered the hour of Issa's word when he said, May your son live, and he and everyone with him believed.
This is for you the second sign in Jalil that was done by Issa.
In Nasira, his home town, he arose in the musalla on the Sabbath to read to the people a portion of the Tawrat.

The Spirit of Allah rests upon me for he has sent me to bring good news to the poor, and to set free the captives. He has sent me to give sight to the blind and to announce the year of victory when I will be a Nasir to every oppressed person.
When Issa finished his words all eyes were fixed on him. He said, Today this word has come true.
Everyone bore witness to it but were in doubt about his message. They said, This is only the son of Yusif. How can this be?
Issa said, I am like a physician to whom it is said, Heal yourself! Do among your family what you did in Kafr Nahum. He said, Surely a prophet has is not acceptable in his own country at all!
Surely there were among Bani Israel many widows when the people suffered drought for three years and almost perished from hunger.
Allah did not send Elias to one of them but he sent him to a Lebanese widow in Sayda.
There were among Bani Israel during the time of the prophet Ilyasha many lepers. But Allah did not heal them, except for Nuaman of Dimashq who became a believer.

When they heard this, anger filled them and they took him out of the city and brought him up to the edge of the mountain to cast him from it. But Allah saved him from them and delivered him cunningly.
He left Nasira and made Kafr Nahum on the edge of the sea his center. This fulfilled the word of the prophet Shaya.
O people of Jalil from the Jordan to the Sea, those crouching in darkness in the shadow of death, behold, you have seen the light dawning.
Issa went among the people preaching, saying, Repent, for I have come to you with the true Din!
While he was walking on the shore of the sea he saw two fishermen, Andri and his brother Safwan fishing.
He said to them, follow me in the way and I will make you gatherers of people. They left their nets at once and followed him directly.
Then he saw Khalifa and Hanna with their father in a boat fixing their nets. He called them to himself and they left the ship and their father and followed him in guidance.
The people surrounded him to listen to the Word of Allah. Then the fishermen put out their anchors and left the two ships to wash their nets.
Issa climbed into one of them that belonged to Safwan and asked him to move it a ways away from the land and he began to teach the people with grace.
Then he said to Safwan, Cross the sea and cast the net. He said, O My Mawla, We have grown tired at night and we have caught nothing. However, I will do what you command me.
They did it and the boat became heavy with the catch in the net, even though their brothers on the sea helped them. They filled the two boats with fish until they almost sank from the weight.
Safwan and those with him were aston­ished, at what happened. He fell at Issa's knees and said, My Mawla, depart from me for I am a sinner to be avoided!
Issa said, Do not fear. You will surely be, as of this day, a gatherer of people.
When they returned to the shore they left their things and went in the way of the Masih for ever.
He went down to Kafr Nahum teaching the people on the Sabbath. They were amazed as he spoke to them with obvious authority.
There was among them a man who had a touch from Shaytan. He moaned and cried, Let us alone! Have you come here to cause us to perish, O Issa? We know that you are the expected Holy One of Allah.
He rebuked him and said, Be silent and come out from the man, O Satan! Satan threw the man to the ground and left him unharmed.
They were amazed and said to one another, What kind of Nasir authority is this? The news about Issa spread throughout the land.

He took with him Khalifa and Hanna to the house of Andri and Safwan, whose mother-in-law had a fever. He drew near to her and touched her hand and raised her from the bed and she began to serve him, for the fever left her.
People came to him in the evening with their various kinds of sicknesses. His hand touched each one of them and he healed.
The demons he cast out and rebuked them for they knew him. They shouted, You are from the Spirit of Allah and are his highest Nasr!

He went out at night seeking a secluded place and prayed to his Lord. The helpers followed in his footsteps and said, Surely the people are hoping for a good deed from you. He said, For this I have gone out. Let us go and we will give good news to the people of the villages.
He traveled about in Jalil preaching the Malakut of Allah and healing the sick and his fame spread throughout Syria and grew.
The paralyzed and the epileptic were brought to him and he healed them and people from many nations followed him.
A leper came to him imploring him and bowed down and said, If only you would cleanse me I will be healed!
He said, Yes, be cleansed. The leprosy left him imme­diately.
He said, Do not tell anyone about it, except the Priest. Show him your healing as was prescribed by Musa.
As his fame increased the people came to hear him and to seek healing. He would preach to them and go to secluded places for prayer.
There came from Bayt el-Maqdis and Jalil a group of faqihs to witness the master healing by the com­mand of Allah and guiding.

A paralyzed man was brought on his bed, his family wanting to lay him between his hands. But as the throng obstructed him, they carried him up to the roof and made an opening in it and lowered him in his bed to Issa.
He admired their faith and said, O man, your sins are forgiven! The faqihs renounced his word and said, No one forgives sin except Allah alone. Who is this then that speaks this blasphemy?
Issa saw through to their hearts and said, Which is easier, to say that your sins are forgiven or to say rise and walk on command?
That you may know that I am able to forgive sin, O man, rise and carry your bed and go to your family! He walked and thanked Allah gratefully.
The people were stirred up and filled with fear but praised Allah and said, By Allah, we have surely seen a wonder today!
Issa went out and saw Matta the tax collector sitting at his table. He said, Follow me in the way. He arose and left the possessions of the world and became one of the Hawariyun.
Matta made a feast in honor of Issa and invited to his house a group of his friends. The faqihs rebuked Issa for this and said to his helpers, Are you eating together with tax collectors and sinners?
Issa said, The healthy do not need a doctor but the sick do. I have not come to invite the righteous to repent. The sinners get that invitation!
A group of them said, These who are followers of Yahya and the faqihs fast and worship. Why then do your helpers take food?
He said, The family of the bridegroom does not fast while he is among them. But when he has left them, then you will see them fasting.
You are like one who tears a piece of a new robe to fix an old robe, thus increasing the tear.
Or like one who fills an old skin with new wine and then it tears it to pieces. New wine is placed in new skins to preserve and protect them.
Surely the one who rejects the new is he who is accustomed to the old and those who desire the new are fewer in number.
During the feast of Id el-Nahr, Issa turned his face towards Bayt el-Maqdis to perform the Hajj.
There, at the Hitta gate, was a group of blind, lame and paralyzed people waiting for an angel to descend in a spring and stir the water. Whoever would then arrive first at the water would be healed.
Issa noticed one sick person stretched out by the water who had been sick for 38 years so confined. Issa knew of his problem and asked, Do you want to be healed?
He said, O sir, who will help me? For whenever the water is stirred and I want to go to it, another goes ahead of me who is stronger.
Issa said, O man, rise and carry your bed and walk! He obeyed him and walked.

A group of Priests complained to him saying, It is not halal for you to carry your bed on the Sabbath. He answered, I am only obeying the one who healed me and com­manded me to carry my burden and walk.
They said, Do you know the one who commanded you to do this? But he did not know him for Issa had gone away from the crowd and disappeared.
When Issa found the man in the House of Allah he said to him, Look, you have been healed! So do not sin any longer or it will be more difficult for you.

He then went quickly to his people and said, O my people, surely Issa is the one who healed me and guided. They then began to make a plot against him. They said, Let him be killed who breaks the sancti­ty of the Sabbath!
Issa said, Surely Allah, my Father, is at work all the time and I, likewise, do as he does wondrously.
The Priests continued in their craftiness and said, See, this man violates the Sabbath and claims that Allah is his Father making himself equal with our exalted Lord!
He said, Truly I say to you, I am not able to do great signs, but as Allah works, I do what I see.
Surely Allah teaches me what he knows and loves me greatly. As Allah brings life to the dead, so do I.
Allah himself judges no one, for he has made me the judge forever. Whoever does not honor me does not honor Allah who sent me and leads.
Surely, whoever follows my word and trusts in the one who sent me has taken hold of the Nasr of Allah. He will not be condemned, but We will carry him from death into life forever.
This is the day of the dead who hear my call, and whoever answers me will live.
Allah is the Living one who made me Lord of mankind has entrusted me with all the Day of Judgment.
It is no sur­prise that the hour is coming when those in the graves will hear my voice plain­ly. Whoever has done good deeds will live. But whoever has done evil, his reward will be the flame.
I do not possess judgment, but I am seeking the favor of Allah who sent me with the truth. I judge as I hear and my judgment is just.
If I have borne witness about myself, then my witness is not legal. Surely another witness of me is Yahya and he was a shining lamp that you sought light from for a while.
He witnessed about me truthfully even though I do not seek a witness from people at all.
Allah is my witness and the great signs that he gave me in addition to the witness of Yahya.
He is Allah whose voice you have not heard and whose face you have not seen. You have only increased in your igno­rance of his word and grown more disbe­lieving in the one he has sent.
Did you think that in the Tawrat you had Nasr? Read the Book, for it witnesses of me. But you do not desire my coming so how can you hope for Nasr?
I know that your hearts had been emptied of love of Allah, therefore I do not ask of you any honor.

I have come to you from Allah but you have disbelieved in me. If a person comes to you from among yourselves you believe in him. Are you to believe while you are seeking for yourselves glory and not from Allah? But that which is from Allah is better and more lasting.
I do not accuse you before Allah. The one who accuses you is your hope Musa.
If you had believed in what Musa brought which spoke of me, you would not have disbe­lieved. If you have then disbelieved in what Musa wrote, can you really believe in me?

On the Sabbath Issa passed with his helpers through the fields. When they became hungry his helpers began to pick the grain and eat it. When the faqihs saw them they said, How is it that your helpers, O Issa, are making halal some of the things that were made haram for us?

He said, Have you read the story of Dawud and his sol­diers? They became hungry and entered into the House of Allah and ate the bread used for offering, something that was not halal for them but was only to be food for the Priests.
Have you not noticed how the Priests in the House of Allah break the sanctity of the Sabbath without objection? Be­hold, here is one who is greater than the House, if only you knew!
If only you understood what was in the Tawrat, that Allah desires mercy in your hearts and not your sacrifices. If you had done this, you would not have spoken to us wrongly.
The Sabbath was made for people, not people for the Sabbath. I am the Lord of the Age so follow my guidance!
While he was teaching the people in the musalla on the Sabbath, he saw a man with a withered right hand. The faqihs were hoping that if he would heal on the Sabbath they would be able to condemn him.
Issa said to the one whose hand was withered, Stand and come to the middle of our gathering! Issa did this knowing by reve­lation what they were hiding, for it was not hidden.
They said, Is healing halal on the Sabbath? He answered, If one of you had a sheep that fell into a pit on the Sabbath, would you pull it out or leave it to perish?
O you pronouncers of haram! Is a person more important or a sheep? Therefore, doing good on the Sabbath is a halal!
He said, Is doing good halal on the Sabbath or doing evil, the saving of life or its destruction? They remained silent.
Issa stared at them being both angry and sad. He said to the man, Stretch forth your hand! It became straight after it had been withered.
The crowd dispersed and the faqihs and the followers of King Antibas formed a plan among themselves against Issa seeking evil.
Issa and those who were with him went to the Sea of Jalil and a crowd followed him who had heard of his signs. They came to him from every direction from the regions of el-Sham seeking to be healed.
The Hawariyun prepared a boat for him so that those seeking healing would not crowd him, for every sick person began trying to make a way to him to touch him with the others who were touching.
Whoever had in him a touch from Shaytan, when they saw him, fell down shouting, You are from the Spirit of Allah! But he commanded them to keep silent concerning himself and he healed them all.
The word of Allah in the Tawrat was fulfilled, This is my servant whom I have chosen, my beloved in whom I am pleased. I have anointed him with my Spirit to reveal my words to all people.
A bruised reed he will not crush, nor a weak flame will he extinguish, neither is he one who shouts or is argumentative.
But he is making a jihad in my path diligently so as to raise up the word of truth. He is the hope of the nations and let those who trust put their trust in him.
Issa went up the mountain in the evening to pray. On the following day in the morning he called to himself the followers and chose from them the twelve Hawariyun.
Safwan, Khalifa and Hanna, these were the first three.
Then Philip, Andri and Matta, Ata, Ibn Halfi and Hamdi; Tuma, Fadi and Yahuda - he chose them all.
They were helpers accompanying him and proclaiming the way of Allah and it was given to them saving power to heal in his name every sickness and to cast out demons.
The helpers sat around their Mawla as he taught and they listened.
Blessed are the believers who confess their poverty toward Allah, for they will be forever in heaven;
And those that sorrow, for they will be comforted;
And the meek, for they will inherit the land;
And those who seek for righteousness, for they shall find their desire;
And the merciful, who will be shown mercy in the resurrection;
And the pure in heart who reject hypocrisy, for they will be satisfied in Allah’s presence.
And the peacemakers, for they will be called Allah’s children..
And the persecuted in the path of Allah, for they are those brought near to their Lord.

And when people oppress you and make fun of you because you are my helpers and invent lies about you, rejoice! For they ridiculed the proph­ets who came before you and you will receive a generous reward.
But woe to those who prophecy and seek the praise of people just as they sought the flat­tery of your fathers before and were deceiving them;
And to the rich who have stored up the reward of the world laughing. In the end they will cry!

Surely in the world you are like salt. It flavors the food of the people and preserves. But if the salt becomes bad, with what will they salt it? The salt will be thrown out since it is no good and it will be trampled by those passing by;
Or you shine like a lamp in a glass as a light for people; or like a city standing on a mountain, that is not hid from eyes. A lighted lamp is not placed in a box, if only you knew.
In this way let your light shine before people’s eyes so that they will witness your good deeds and proclaim, Allahu Akbar, who is the Hearer and the Seer.
Do you think that I have come to abrogate the Sharia of Musa and the books of the Messengers? Of course not! But I have come to fulfill Din for you.
Truly not one letter or dot will disappear from the Tawrat until the heavens disappear and that which is certain has come.
Whoever disobeys even a small thing that Musa commanded and teaches other people to do so has strayed from the true Din.
But whoever keeps it and teaches others to do so has made good his Din. But you will not enter into the Umma of Allah unless you are more righteous than the faqihs.

It has been said to you, Keep your vows and do not swear with a lie. This is the commandment of your forefathers. But I complete it with my word, Do not swear at all; not by heaven for it is the throne of Allah, neither by the earth for it is his footstool, neither by Bayt el-Maqdis for it is the city of the great King.
Do not swear by your heads for you are not able to turn one hair either black or white. Just say yes or no. For more than that is from Shaytan and is an obvious slander.

It has been said, do not commit adultery. This is the commandment of your forefathers. I, your Mawla, am completing so listen to me. Whoever lusts after a woman has a heart that is a sinful adulterer.
If your eye is adulterous, tear it out and your hand- if it is adulterous, cut it off. It is better for you to lose one member than for you to be thrown into hell.
It was said to you, Whoever divorces his wife must give her a legal paper. But I say that whoever divorces his wife, except for adultery, has become an adulterer as well.
It was said to you, Do not kill and whoever murders will receive his punishment. This was the commandment of your forefa­thers.
Behold, I complete it for you with my clear word, Whoever hates his brother and puts down his brothers with curses, will receive the reward of hell where he will be roasted on the day of judgment.
Cut off your prayers if you remember that your brother has something against you. Go first to him and give him what is rightfully his. Then return and do the prayers with the worshipers.
For to be reconciled with your adversary and quickly give him his right is better than to be impri­soned and be forced to be reconciled.

It was said to you, An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth. This was the commandment of your forefathers. But I am your Mawla so listen to me. To whomever slaps your left cheek, turn to him your right cheek. To whomever does you wrong, do not take revenge on him but do him good.
To whomever attempts to take your garment desiring it, give him your coat as well. Whoever forces you to walk one mile, walk with him two not being selfish.
Whoever requests from you anything or wants to borrow, give it to him and do not return him disappointed. Do to others as you would love for yourselves. Surely this is the true word so listen to me!

It was said to you, Love your brethren and hate your enemies. This was the word of your forefathers. But I say to you, Love your enemies and do good to those who hate you. Pray for those that curse you and bless those that do you evil.
Love your enemies and lend to Allah a good loan and he will multiply your reward and you will become his close friends.
He is Allah whose mercy has covered every­thing. He sends his sun on the evil and the righteous and sends down his rain on the just and the oppressors.
What merit is it if you love those who love you or do good to those who do good to you? This is what sinners do!
What merit is it to give a loan to those whom you can count on? This is the way sin­ners lend to other sinners.
If you only greet your brethren what merit is this? Even the unbelievers do that! Therefore, be eager to do good and do it in a better way. For Allah is the best of those who do good.
Issa said, Beware of worshiping to be seen by people so that you lose your reward. For Allah is aware of what you do.
In this way the hypocrites give their zakat and make obvious their alms in the musallas and in the streets, thereby seeking thanks from people. They will be rewarded with what they have earned.
There­fore, make secret your alms and do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing. Allah will reward you for he does not lose the reward of those who do good.
Do not be like the hypocrites who in their prayers in the Musallas and in the streets make a big show. They will be reward­ed with what they have earned.
Therefore, when you do your salat, do it in an isolated place. Lock your doors and call upon Allah who will answer you and reward you. For with Allah is the gener­ous reward.

Do not be like the hypocrites who try to pressure Allah with their prayers in order to be answered. Allah is near to answer the requests of his beloved, for before you call upon him he knows what you need.
When you do salat, call upon your Lord humbly. Allahumma, Lord of all the world, let your great remem­brance be lifted up, may your wise command be executed, may your glory spread among all people.

O Lord, provide for us from your good things according to the need of each day. O Lord, forgive us our sins as we forgive those who sin against us. O Lord, strengthen us when you test our faith. O Lord, deliver us from Shaytan the accursed.
O Possessor of sovereignty, O one full of glory and honor, in all the world you alone are strong and firm.
Forgive other people their sins and Allah will forgive yours. For if you forgive the sins of others, surely Allah is the Forgiving and the Merciful.
Do not be like the hypo­crites who exhibit to other people their sawm with frowning faces. Truly I say to you, they will receive their reward with what they have earned.
When you do your sawm, do not show others that you are doing sawm. Wash your face and wipe your head and Allah will see you and he will reward you. How wonderful is the reward of the sincere!

Do not judge other people and Allah will not judge you. If you forgive, you will be forgiven. If you give, it will be given to you, pressed together, shaken down and over­flowing. For as you measure, it will be measured to you.
Do not give to the dogs what Allah has entrust­ed to you. Neither cast your pearls to pigs for they will turn around and attack you, tearing you to pieces.
He told them the parable how a blind person is not able to lead another blind person for both will fall into a hole.
Do you see the speck in the eye of your brother and ask to remove it while there is a log in your own eye that you do not notice?
No hypocrisy! Instead, start with yourself before your brother. Take out the log in your own eye first and then you will see clearly the speck in your brother's and you will be doing well.

The eye is the lamp of the body. If your eye is clear the body is lit up with light. But if it is envious, the whole body has become dark. Therefore, beware that the light that is in you does not turn to darkness and you perish.
Do not let the treasures of this world lure you away from the treasures of the hereaf­ter. Whatever you accumulate on earth, moths and rust will eat and thieves will steal it and it will not remain.
The servant cannot serve two masters together. He either follows the first in love or leaves the other in hate. Likewise, you cannot serve Allah and money together.
Is your food and drink better than life? Is your clothing better than the body? Do not follow after the things of the world.

Do you not watch the birds? They do not plant, harvest or store seeds but Allah provides for them. Are you not more worthy to be provided for? Even if any of you wanted to in­crease his height by a span he would not be able.
Why does your clothing concern you? Look at the lily how without spinning or fatigue it grows. Surely Sulayman in all his glory was not dressed as the lilies are dressed.

Likewise, Allah clothes the flowers of the earth and causes them to sprout today while you throw them on the fire after they have withered tomor­row. Surely you are more worthy for Allah to dress. How little you believe!
Do not say in disbelief, What shall we eat, drink and put on? Allah knows better what you need.

Instead, seek that which pleases Allah and he will increase for you from his bounty everything. Do not be preoccupied with what will matter tomorrow. The next day will take care of itself. Each day you have enough to occupy you.
Call upon Allah and he will answer you. Seek him and you will find him and it will be opened for you and so you will be provided for.

If your child asks you for a piece of bread will you give him a stone? If he asks you for a fish will you give him a snake? Of course not! You, being human, give your children good gifts. Likewise, Allah The Fatherly will provide for you for he is the best of providers.
Desire for your brethren what you want for yourselves as a fulfillment of Musa and the prophets.
They have surely perished who enter life through the wide gate and easy road, and they are many.
Instead, enter it through the narrowest of its gates and be guided to what is straightest. You will win the Nasr of Allah. But how few are those who are guided!
Do not be deceived by false prophets that wear the clothing of lambs but inside are wolves that will kidnap you. By their fruit you will know them, so be cautious.
The good tree produces only good fruit. Likewise, the bad only produces bad. The fruit truly speaks of the tree. You cannot pick grapes from the bramble. You cannot gather figs from the thistle.
Good things come from the good and bad things come from the bad and what is in their hearts they speak.
Surely the tree with bad fruit, is cut down and thrown into the fire. The one who speaks bad words will be repaid. With your tongue you are saved or lose on the Day of Judgment.
Do you think that whoever calls me Mawla will enter the Umma of Allah imme­diately? Of course not! But whoever does the will of Allah will enter.
Truly many of you on the Day of Judgment will say, Our Mawla, we prophesied in your name! Our Mawla, in your name we defeated demons!
Our Mawla, in your name we did various miracles! But I will deny them and say to them, Go away, O evil ones!
Whoever hears my word and does it, is like a wise person who founded his building on a rock. When the heavens rained and the flood rose and the wind blew, it was firmly established.
But whoever does not do my word is like a foolish person who founded his build­ing on sand. When the rain fell and the flood rose and the wind blew, it was among those that fell.
When Issa finished his word the people were bewil­dered for the faqihs had not come to them with anything like his clear authority.
Issa came to Kafr Nahum and was met by a delegation of a Ruman officer whose beloved servant was dying of a disease.
Some of the Priests urged him to go and heal the servant, saying, Surely this Hanif is worthy of your help for he loves our people and has even built us a musalla.
Issa responded to their request. When he came near the house, the Rumani sent a friend to carry a message.
Do not let the master be bothered, for I am not worthy for him to come to me and I am not worthy to go to him. If only with a word he will speak about my servant he will be healed.
For when I have a matter for my soldiers, they do what I command them to do in obedience.
Issa was surprised at his message and said to his helpers, I have not seen, even among Bani Israel, faith and surrender like this!

You will see the eastern and the western parts of the earth entering into the Umma of Allah in crowds, and in el-Janna they will recline on cushions calling for drinks and fruits with Ibrahim and his family forever.
But the people to whom Allah had set apart for his Umma but then who disbelieved, their abode will be the fire and it will be a terrible fate. They will grind their teeth and weep bitterly.
When the delegation returned to the house of the Rumani, the servant had recovered.
On the next day Issa and those with him turned to the village of Nin. He saw at the gate of the village a group of people carrying a corpse, and he was an only child of a widow.

He felt pity for the widowed mother and he said to her, Do not cry, as he approached the burial procession. He stopped it and touched him saying, Rise, O youth! The dead person sat up alive and began to speak to the people!
The people were awed and began to shout, Allahu Akbar! They exclaimed, A righteous prophet has come to us who is to his people a savior! The news about Issa spread through the land.

As Issa was healing the blind and the sick and casting out demons, a delegation came to him from Yahya who was in prison and said to him, We are both messengers from Yahya sent to inquire about you. Are you the Masih whom we are expecting or not?

He said, Return and tell Yahya, We have seen the blind regain their sight, the lame walking, the lepers cleansed, the deaf hearing, the dead being raised and the poor receiving the good news. Blessed is he who does not disbelieve in me!

They left and Issa said to the people, What did you see in the desert? A reed shaken by the wind or a king living luxuriously in his palace? I say to you, truly Yahya is greater than just a prophet and is more eminent.
Do you not remember what is spoken of in the Tawrat, We have sent one who will prepare before you a way?

Truly none born from women is as great as Yahya. Since he began his call to repentance until now, people have been making a Jihad to enter into the Umma of Allah being guided. But the least of those entering is the greatest of people before Allah in standing.

And when the people and the tax collectors heard this, they praised Allah The Just, for Yahya had immersed them. But the fanatics and the learned rejected what Allah wanted for them and were not immersed. For until Yahya came there were the books of the prophets and Musa. Let those hear well who truly have hearts. Yahya is Elias in spirit and strength.

For if Yahya comes to you not eating or drinking, you say that Shaytan has touched him. But if Issa comes from Allah as Nasr, eating as you eat and drinking as you drink, you say that he is a glutton and a drunkard and takes sinners and tax collectors as friends.

Surely you are like children who fill the courtyards mocking, We played tunes for you but you did not dance, we mourned for you but you did not cry. You say this as a proverb. But wisdom by its deeds speaks its utterance.
Issa then extolled and worshiped, Praise to Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth, who has chosen by his will the simple instead of the important and so revealed.
He is Allah who has granted and given me everything. No one knows me except him and no one knows him except I and whoever I want to show to him and reveal.
O you who are tired and sinking under your burdens with difficulty. I am the Gentle and the Loving one, Come and follow in my path and you will find rest and relief.
When Shimun the faqih invited him to his house, he prepared a feast and a woman knew about it and came carrying perfume.
She fell at his feet kissing, crying and rubbing them with her tears and the perfume and wiping them with her hair in love.
Shimun was amazed at what he saw and said to himself, If Issa was a prophet, he would have known that this woman was a big sinner.
Issa said, O Shimun, I have something to say to you. Shimun said, Speak, O teacher. Then Issa told him a parable.
There was a creditor who had two people who could not pay their debts so he forgave them.
One of them owed five hundred dinars as a burden, the other owed fifty dinars as an amount. Which of the two debtors will have greater love?

Shimun answered, I think the one who was forgiven the greater debt will love the creditor more. Issa turned to the woman and said to Shimun, You are right. Do you see this woman? I entered your house and you did not give me water for me to wash my feet, but this woman wet them with her tears and wiped them with her hair. You did not kiss me, but she has not stopped kissing my feet. You did not wipe my head with oil, but she has wiped my feet with perfume. Allah has forgiven her sins that are past so she has loved greatly.
For whoever loves only a little will be forgiven only a little.
Therefore, O woman, Allah has forgiven you!, said Issa.
Those who were with him at the table ex­claimed, Who is this that even forgives adultery! He said, O woman, your faith has given you Nasr. Go in peace and guidance.
Issa, the Hawariyun and the other followers went throughout the cities and villages calling to the Malakut of Allah and spreading the good news.
There was Mary Majdaliya whom Issa had healed of seven Jinn, Hanan the wife of the minister of the king, and Sawsan and the others who contributed from their money in the way of Issa in support.

When Issa returned to the house the people crowded around so that he and his disciples could not get any food. His family came to bring him back to them for a rumor had spread that a touch from Shaytan was in him.

A group of people brought him a possessed person who could not speak or see. He healed him and he spoke and saw. The people were amazed at what had happened and said, By Allah, this certainly must be the awaited Masih!

The faqihs said, Surely Issa gets help to overpower the demons by means of Taghut! Issa replied, Shaytan does not cast out Shaytan, unless the kingdom of Shaytan fights against itself and is destroyed. Likewise, a nation, a city or a household, if it fights against itself, will fail and its strength will melt away.

If by the Spirit of Allah I cast out demons, then surely the Malakut of Allah has come to you as Nasr. But if I, by Taghut, cast out demons, by whom do your followers cast them out? Therefore, your own followers condemn on you!
No one can rob the house of a strong person unless he is stronger. He will then bind him and disarm him and plunder his house completely.
Whoever does not gather with me is a scatterer. Whoever is not with me is my enemy.
I say to you, surely Allah will forgive your sins and your lying slanders against the master of mankind. But he will never forgive those who disbelieve in his Spirit.

A group of the faqihs said, Will you do another sign? He answered, To the corrupt there will be no sign except the sign of Yunus. He remained in the belly of the whale for three days. Likewise, Issa will remain in the belly of the earth for three days and then be raised up alive.
On the day when that great hour has come, the people to whom Yunus was sent will bring you into account. For they repented to Allah after there came to them a warner.
And there is Bilqis, the queen of Yemen of old, who came to Sulayman from Saba to learn wisdom and to benefit. And Issa is great­er than Yunus and Sulayman and more lasting.

You are like one whom Shaytan has touched. Shaytan is then cast out and wanders through the desert seeking rest but to no avail. He returns to his house which he was cast out of and finds it empty and ordered. He then goes and brings seven jinn even more wicked than himself and they make in him an abode.
Is not, then, the end of the evil worse than the first state? See what the punishment of the corrupt is and how very disastrous!
A woman shouted and said, Blessed is the one who bore you and nursed you as a child! Issa replied, Yet truly blessed is the one who obeys Allah in word and deed!

His mother and his brothers came to him and stood outside the house wanting to speak to him. He was informed of their coming but motioned to his helpers and said, My true mother and brothers are those that are my helpers in the way of Allah. For whoever does the will of Allah, my Father, will be my family.
Issa returned to the shore of the sea of Jalil teaching the people. They crowded him so that he climbed into a boat in the sea and sat and told them a parable.
A sower while he was plant­ing seed dropped some seed on the path. But birds came and fell upon it and picked it up as food.
Some of the seed fell on rocks and it grew up quickly since it had no depth to it. But when the sun came out on that which had no roots, it consumed it, burning it and withering it.
Some of it fell among thorns and sprang up but the thorns choked it and it did not give fruit.
But that which fell on good ground, grew and brought forth its shoot and support­ed it and it became firm on its stalk and gave fruit in abundance.
Surely in this is an admonition for those who have hearts and who fear Allah.
His Hawariyun approached him and asked, Why do you speak to the people in para­bles? He replied, Your Lord has ac­quainted you more than others with the secrets of his Malakut.

Whoever has been favored, to him we will increase favor. Whoever has little, for him we will decrease what he has. I speak to the people in parables, for they look but do not see and listen but do not hear, neither do they understand a word.

The word of Allah has come true about them in the Tawrat, They have ears but they do not hear with them and they have eyes but they do not see with them. Their hearts are hard and they refuse to hear and see and understand from their hearts will not repent. How can they hope for healing from me?

But you are blessed for your eyes see and your ears hear. Truly I say to you that both the prophets and the righteous ones longed to see what you see and to hear what you hear, but it was not for them like this.
Whoever listens to the word of the Malakut but does not consider it carefully, is like the planting along the path. Shaytan comes and snatches it away from his heart.

The one that receives the word of the Malakut hastily and joyfully, is like the planting on the rocks which had no root to it. It grows for a while but if he is persecuted because of the word, he completely forsakes it.
The planting that was choked by the thorns and did not produce good fruit is like one who listens to the word of the Malakut but is captivated by the things of this world .
But whoever hears the word of the Malakut with a good heart, surrenders to it, becomes firm in it and keeps it, is like the planting in the good earth that grew.
A lamp is not lit under a bed to be hid but is made prominent for those inside as a light and for guid­ance.
What is hidden from people will be revealed later.
Listen to the word of the Malakut well. Whoever has favor will increase in favor. Whoever has not, that which he has will be taken away.
The Malakut of Allah is like one who planted his field well. But his enemy came in the night and cast tares among the wheat and left.
When the seed came up and produced grain there appeared both the weeds and the tares together.
His servants came to him and said, O sir, we thought that you only planted the field with wheat. How did the tares come up? He answered, An enemy has done this!
They said, Do you order us to pull up the tares? He said, No, for I am afraid that while you are gathering the tares you will pluck up the wheat with it.
Leave the wheat to grow with the weeds until the day of harvest comes.
On that day the harvesters will gather the tares in bundles and cast them into the fire. But the wheat I will surely bring to my storehouse.
The Malakut of Allah is like one who plants his field, then sleeps at night and then rises in the day. The planting sprouts and grows but he does not know its secret for it is hidden.

The earth brings forth the grass, then the ears, then the ears are full of wheat. When the wheat ripens and the planting is ready to be harvested, the harvester hurries to his field carrying a sickle.
Or it is like a tiny grain of mustard. It is planted, then it grows and then it becomes a large tree so that the birds can nest in its branches.
Or it is like yeast that is added to three measures of flour that leavens the dough completely.
In this way did Issa tell parables giving examples to the people and teaching them Din. When he took the Hawariyun aside he further provided them with knowledge about everything.
The word of the Tawrat was fulfilled in the Book, I will speak with parables and raise to light what was hidden from the beginning of the world like a veil.
Issa left the crowds and sought refuge in a house. The Hawariyun said, Our Mawla, if only you would give us insight into the parable of the weeds of the field.
He said, I am the one who sowed the people of taqwa as wheat in the field of the world.
As for the tares, they are the helpers of Shaytan, the enemy, who has sown them by scattering them among the wheat at night.
The harvesters are the angels on the Day of Gathering when the first life has ended.
As the tares are gathered in bundles to be consumed by fire, so it will be on the day of gathering but even worse.

On that day the master of mankind will send the angels to separate the wheat from the tares. They will gather the helpers of Shaytan and cast them into hell like firewood where they will grind their teeth and weep bitterly.
But those who believe and do good will have el-Janna as their refuge. Their faces will be radiant like the sun as they live there for eternity. Surely in this is an admonition to whoever will fear.
The Malakut of Allah is like a treasure buried in a field that a person finds and then hides it to protect it. Then he goes rejoicing and sells all that he possesses and buys the field.
Or it is like a merchant who is searching for pearls. When he finds a huge one he goes and sells what he owns completely and buys.
Or it is like a net which was cast into the sea and which gathered all kinds of fish.
When it was full the fishers brought it out and chose what was good from it and tossed the bad to the side.
That is the way it will be on the day when the hour will come and the angels will chose the good and cast the sinners into hell as firewood.

Issa said to his Hawari­yun, Do you understand? They said, Yes. He said, Whoever follows me from among the learned is like one who has treasure. He brings out both the new and the old from which he has gained and gave.
Issa called his helpers in the evening to cross over the Sea of Jalil to the east.
They rode in Issa's boat as other boats followed them and they left behind them on the shore crowds of people.
Issa moved to the side of the boat and rested on a pillow to sleep. But the wind blew up a storm and the waves became rough and struck the boat so that it almost filled to the point of sinking.
The helpers hurried to their Mawla and awakened him and said to him, Surely we are about to perish and drown!
Issa rose up and rebuked the sea and said, Be still, O sea! The wind became quiet in obedience and a complete calm prevailed.
He then said to his helpers, Are you afraid as if faith has not entered your hearts? They said to one another in fear and awe, Who is this that even the wind and sea obey him!
When they reached the eastern shore of the sea in the pagan area of Julan, a man met him who had a touch of Shaytan in him and who had made the cemetery his habitat.

Every time they tried to chain him he broke his chains defiantly and he roamed among the tombs and the mountains throughout the night and day striking himself with rocks and filling the place with cries.
When he saw Issa coming he hurried to him falling down, pleading and shouting, By Allah, do not torment me! If only you would leave me alone, O Word of Allah, O Issa!
He said this because Issa had said to him, O band of jinn, come out from this man immediate­ly!
Issa asked them their name and they said, We are called, because of our great number, the army! Then they pleaded with him not to expel them from that land and what a large band of demons it was!
There was present there a herd of pigs feeding on the mountain. The demons asked him to send them into the pigs and he permitted them.
They came out of the man and entered into two thousand pigs. The pigs rushed down the mountain into the sea and were all drowned.
The shepherds were terri­fied by what they saw and turned and fled and informed the villages, and the people came out to see what had hap­pened.
When they came to Issa, the one in whom there was an army of demons was sitting there, neither possessed or naked. The people were greatly alarmed.
As witnesses told them of what had happened to the man, the demons and the pigs, their fear increased and they asked Issa to leave their land and he agreed.
As he was getting into the boat, the man in whom the demons had lived asked him permission to accompany him but he refused.
He said, Return to your people and tell of the grace of your Lord who healed you and guided.
The man set out to tell the good news to the people from Dimashq to Amman and everywhere in between and the people saw the wonder.
When Issa and those with him arrived at Kafr Nahum, its people met him at the shore with joy.

There came to him a sheikh of the Musalla from among them whose name was Munir and he fell on his face pleading. He said, My daughter is about to die from an illness. Can you put your hand on her so she will be healed? Issa went while the people crowded around him .
Relate in the Book the woman from Kafr Nahum who met him in the way and who had had a bleeding for twelve years.
She had suffered under the care of physicians as she had spent all that she owned and had not become well but instead had become sicker.

When she heard the news about Issa she cut through the waves of people from behind and reached him. She touched his robe for she believed that by what she was doing she would be healed. She knew that she was healed from her flow immediately.

As Issa felt that power had gone out from him, he said to the people, Which one of you touched my robe? The Hawariyun said, Do you ask this as the people are press­ing you? He turned his look towards the people to see.
The woman was frightened and came and bowed down before him and told him what had hap­pened.
He said, O my daughter, go in peace and be healed, for your faith has truly made you well.
Then some men came and informed the sheikh of the death of his daughter. They said, Do not let the teacher be bothered. Issa said to him, Do not fear, for if you believe she will live!
He chose to accompany him Safwan, Khalifa and Hanna. When they arrived, Issa heard in the house a commotion and saw people weeping and mourning.
Issa entered and made the people stop crying and said, The child has not died, for this sleeping one lives!

They made fun of him, but he put them all outside while he took the parents of the child and those with him into where she lay. Then Issa took her hand and said to her, O child, I say to you rise! She arose immediately and began to walk.
She was a girl only twelve years old and all were amazed. He ordered that she be given something to eat and that no one know about what had hap­pened.
Issa left them and two blind men followed Issa him crying out, O Our Mawla, have mercy on us!
He asked, Do you believe that I am able to do it? They said, You are truly able to do it!
So he touched their eyes and said, Let it be according to your faith, and they saw after their blindness.
He said to them, Do not mention this to anyone. So they went out and the news became in the land as a parable.
They brought him a dumb person who had in him a touch from Shaytan. When Issa cast out the jinn, the dumb man spoke well.
The people were amazed and said, By Allah, we have not seen in the Land of Promise anything like this!
Some of the faqihs said that by Taghut he was casting out the jinn.
He left Kafr Nahum with those accompanying him and went to Nasira. There he began to teach the people on the Sabbath and they were captivated by his wisdom and miracles.
