They asked, How does he do it, for he is only the carpenter, the son of Mariam and his brothers Khalaf, Zayd, Samia and Hamad, as well as his sisters, are all here. So they rejected him ignorantly.
No prophet is without honor, except in his own country among his people and his family, said Issa.
He was surprised at the weakness of their faith and did not do any more important miracles there, except among a few that he laid his hand on and healed.
Issa toured the cities and villages teaching the people in the musallas of Allah and proclaiming the Malakut of Allah and healing their sicknesses from which they were suffering.
When he saw all the miserable people like sheep without a shepherd, he had pity on them for they were scattered and waiting.
He said to his followers, O my people, how great is the harvest and how few are the workers. Pray to Allah to send into his harvest those that will work.
He called the Hawariyun and sent them to proclaim the Malakut of Allah. He gave them clear authority to heal the sick and to cast out demons.
He said, Start with the lost sheep of Bani Is­rael. Call to the Umma of Allah whomev­er you meet. Stay away from the impurity of idols and do not become involved with the Samiriyun.
As you heal the sick, raise the dead, cleanse the lepers and cast out demons, give it for the sake of Allah who gives to you without charge.
Do not be obliged to take supplies for the trip which you must carry. No gold, silver or copper and no walking stick, food or clothes, for your provision is from Allah, O workers!
When you come to a village, inquire about who is a virtuous person there. Spend the nights there and remain in his house until the day you depart.

When you enter a house, greet the family with a greeting from Allah. Whoever returns it and then listens to what has been revealed to you, the Salam of Allah will be upon them and they will be the gainers.
But those who reject your call will be in a worse situation than the people that Lut preached to on the day of accounting. Shake off their dust from your feet and leave them in a state of loss.
The messengers are like sheep among plunder­ing wolves. Beware of them as you would a snake, but walk the path of a dove in meekness.

If they issue a fatwa against your faith in me and whip you in front of the musallas and drive you to kings and rulers, and they will surely do this, give a witness for me before the people, O messengers!

Speak that which has been revealed to you and do not be pressured ahead of time about how you will witness. For the Spirit of Allah will speak to them through your tongues and it will really not be you who are speaking.
On that day a father will denounce his son and a brother his own brother. Sons will disobey their fathers and kill them.
If everyone hates you because of your faith, cling to me for you will have Nasr.
If one city treats you wrongly then turn to another. For when you have preached to all of Bani Israel I will return to you, so listen to me.
A disciple is not better than his teacher, nor a servant than his master. It is enough that, in virtue they are the same.
If the lord of the house is Taghut as they claim, then how are you, O family of my house, to be de­scribed?

Do not fear them. Nothing is hidden that will not be revealed to the eyes and what I say to you in the dark, speak it in the light. Proclaim from the rooftops what I tell you in secret and what you hear.

Do you fear those that kill the body but not the spirit, because they are not able to? Instead, fear Allah who can cause them both to perish in hell together. You should fear Him, if only you understood.

Do not fear them, for no bird falls to the ground except with the permission of Allah. He is your Fatherly God and protects you. Not a single hair will leave your heads without him counting it. You are much dearer to him than the birds, O chil­dren!
For whoever testifies of me on the earth, I will testify of him in heaven. Whoever denies me before people, I will deny him before Allah. So will you not take refuge?
Do you think that I have come to bring only peace? No, but a furqan between a father and his children, a brother and his broth­ers and a house and its members. All men will hate you.
If you love your parents and your children more than you love me or follow a path other than mine with its hardships, you will not have Nasr.
If you preserve your life you will lose it, but if you lose it in my path you will preserve it forever.

Whoever re­sponds to you, it is as if he responded to me. Whoever responds to me has believed in the one who has sent me. Whoever receives a messenger or a God-fearing person will be rewarded as the one they receive. In this manner we reward the believers.
Whoever gives a cup of water to the least of you will have his reward from Allah. For Allah does not lose the reward of those who do good.
The Hawariyun spread out through the land calling people to repentance, casting out demons and anointing the sick with oil and healing.
The news of Issa spread among the people and they said different things about him.
Allah has sent Yahya, after his death, doing miracles for those who saw him.
One group said that it was Elias, for they were expect­ing him.
Others said that Issa is a messenger like the messengers of old.
When King Antibas heard this he said, Who is this but Yahya, whose head I cut off and whom Allah has raised up from among the dead!
This is the story of Yahya for whom Hirudya, the wife of the king, had planned a trap, and she was among the wicked.

She had divorced her hus­band because of her love for his brother the king, and then married him. But Yahya had rebuked him for his lusts and said, The wife of your brother is haram to you, so do not be a sinner!
The king was furious with him and said, You will be imprisoned for a while.
His wife kept it to her­self but grew mad at him and wished that she could kill him. This is in spite of the fact that the king feared him and listened to him, for Yahya was righteous.
The king had a feast in honor of his birthday and the Ahbar of Jalil were invited to come and cele­brate.

When the daughter of the wife of the king entered, she danced and all the people were enthralled. The king said to her, after he was filled with wine, By Allah, I will give you half of my kingdom if you desire!
She went out to ask her mother what she should request. She told her, The head of Yahya you shall ask!
She hurried to the king and said, The head of Yahya, now, on a platter you will provide!
The king was filled with sorrow but nothing was left for him to do except to fulfill his oath.
So he sent his guard to the prison and he brought the head of Yahya on a platter and presented it to the wife of the king who was the revenger.
The followers of Yahya came and buried him in the ground and brought to Issa this important news.
When the Hawariyun returned they met with Issa and reported to him what they had done.
As waves of people coming and kept them too busy to eat, Issa called them to look for an isolated area so that they could rest.
They rode in a boat but the people knew the way they were going and raced to them from every direction on foot.
When they reached their destination, Issa got out at the spring of Tabigha and saw a throng of people waiting for him.
But he had mercy on them for they were like sheep without a shepherd and he began teaching them so that they would be guided.
His Hawariyun approached him and said, The day has been long with the people in this place. Tell them to go out in the land and look for food. Issa replied, You give them something to eat!
Philip the Hawari was surprised and said, If we brought them two hundred dinars worth of bread, each one would not even receive a small piece of it, so how can this be?
Andri the Hawari said, This boy is carrying five loaves of barley and two fish, but surely this will make only a small spread, so how can they be satisfied?
He commanded them to make the people sit down and they covered the grass row by row, five thousand men not counting the women and the children. In every row there were a hundred or fifty.
Issa took the five loaves and the two fish and raised his eyes to heaven giving thanks and gave them to his helpers and they fed all the people.
When they were filled he said to his helpers, Gather the excess of food, and they did so and filled twelve baskets from what was left from those who had eaten.
The people were amazed at this sign from Issa and said, By Allah, this is surely the coming Masih!

But Issa discerned their hearts for they were determined to make him a king over them. So he sent off the Hawariyun in the boat to go to the other shore before him and left them and went to a mountain to be alone for awhile.
The Hawariyun rode on the sea in the evening wanting to reach Kafr Nahum.

When the night became dark and the wind became a storm and the sea was stirred up and Issa was not with them, they were miserable. Issa saw them and came to them before dawn walking on the sea. When they saw him they all thought it was a ghost and they screamed in fear.
He said, I am he, do not be afraid!

Safwan said, If you are Issa, command me to come to you on the water. So he called him and he left the boat and walked. But he became afraid as the wind blew and he was about to sink. He called for help saying, My Mawla, will you not save me?
Issa stretched forth his hand to him and saved him from drowning. He said to him, Why unbelief after faith and doubt after certainty?
When he got into the boat the wind quieted down and those in the boat bowed down before him saying, We make the shahada that you are the Word Of Allah and from you we seek help!
Immediately they reached the shore. In Majdal, on the shore of the sea, they cast their an­chors and the people hurried to him from every direction from wherever they were.
They carried their sick on beds and placed them in the middle of the squares, wanting a touch from his robe for they were being healed.

Another group of them remained on the shore of the bread for they knew that he did not set sail with his helpers and they searched for him. Those who came from Tabariya, when they did not find him, sailed to Kafr Nahum searching.

They found him in its musalla teaching the people. They asked, how did you arrive? Issa answered, I do not reckon that because of the signs you seek me, but it is the bread that I fed you that you desire.
Do not work for the bread of this world but for the bread of the next which I, the Masih, will give you and through it you will live forever.
They asked, How can we please Allah? He said, Allah wants you to believe in me, so obey me.
They said, What is your sign so that we can believe in you? Because it is written in the Tawrat, He sent down to them the Manna as bread from heaven for our forefathers.
Issa said, No, Musa did not send down for you bread from heaven. Instead, it is from Allah alone, for he is the best of those that send down.
But the bread of Allah is surely he who came down from heaven to the people and by whom they have Nasr.
They said, Our Mawla, give us from this bread always.
Issa said, I am the bread of life. Whoever comes to me and believes in me will never be hungry, neither will he thirst. Al­though you behold me you do not really see me.
No one can come to me unless he is guided by Allah and whoev­er comes will never be sent away.
Surely I did not come down from heaven seeking my own way, but the will of Allah who sent me to shepherd all those who believe in me and to save them on the Day of Judgment.
Whoever is guided and believes in me has taken hold of His Nasr and in the hereafter will be a winner.
The faqihs were furious about what they heard and said, How can he descend from heaven being only Issa the son of Yusif, for we know his parents?

Issa said, Do not be angry, for no one can follow my way unless he is attracted by Allah. Those are the ones I will give Nasr and resurrect them on the Day of Judgment and they are the ones, as the prophets have said, who are guided.
No one has ever seen Allah except the one who descended from Allah. Whoever believes in me has surely taken hold of the Nasr of Allah and he will live forever.
Where are your forefathers who ate the Manna in the Sinai? Have they not died?
I am the bread of life who has come down from heaven. Will you not eat of me?
For if you eat of this bread of mine, you will live forever.
For my bread is my body which I will give as a ransom for all people.
The people were amazed at what they heard and said, arguing, How can this man offer his body as food for those that eat?
Issa said, Unless you eat of my body and drink of my blood, you are the greatest losers.
If you do this, in the here­after, you will be the winners.
My body is the true bread so eat me, and my blood is the true drink, so drink me.
If you do this, I will be in you and you will be firmly established.
For as I live in Allah, the Living one who has sent me, so will he who eats of me also live in me.
Is the bread that comes down from heaven better, or the manna which your dead forefa­thers ate?
For whoever eats of this bread will live forever and truly they will be the happy ones.
A group of his followers then said, This teaching is difficult for the people. How will they understand?
As it was apparent to Issa what they intended, he said to the Hawariyun, After hearing my words will you also reject them?
How will it be when I make my Araj to heaven where I was before and you see me?
Surely the spirit is life and the body is death and my words are spirit and life for you if only you knew.
As Issa knew beforehand those who would not believe in him and he who would betray him, he said to his followers, Surely there are among you those that do not believe.
For no one can believe unless Allah bestows that upon him and he becomes guided.
His words had an impact on them and many abandoned him and they began to disperse.

When Issa perceived their unbelief he said, Who are my helpers to Allah? Safwan said, We are your helpers to Allah and we have no life except in your eternal words. We have believed that you are the Holy One of Allah, so witness that we are believers!
Issa said, I have chosen you as the twelve Hawariyun but surely one of you is a Shaytan. If you only knew, he is to betray!
A group of the faqihs came to him from Bayt el-Maqdis and accused some of his helpers of not washing their hands before they ate.
For they were careful to purify their bodies, their cooking vessels and their food in the tradition of their forefathers.
They said, O Issa, what has prevented your helpers from purifying their hands when they eat, or are they devi­ating from the tradition of our forefathers?
Issa replied, The word of the Tawrat has been fulfilled, O hypocrites!
This people honor me with their mouths but their hearts are far away. They follow the empty traditions prescribed by some of their own people and so worship.
Are you to follow the traditions of people and be engaged with pots and cups that you wash while you abandon the Book of Allah?
Did not Musa command you to honor your parents and warn you of death if you did not do them good?
If one of you has something with which he is able to help his parents, but then says, I will instead present it as a sacrifice, do you excuse him from giving to his parents and thus forbidding?
O group of Yahud, you are certain­ly doing tahrif of the word from its place in order to follow the traditions that you inherited previously. Many things like this you are doing!
O people, come to me, listen and understand me!
Impurity is not what enters the stomachs of people but impurity is what comes out of their hearts.
His Hawariyun approached him and said, The faqihs are angry about what you have said. Issa answered them, Every planting that is not of Allah will be pulled up!
Leave them alone, for they are blind people leading the blind and both will fall into the pit.
Safwan asked, Explain impurity. Issa answered, Do you still not under­stand?
There is no impurity in what you eat for it does not enter into your hearts but into your stomachs and then passes out. Therefore, all your food and drink is halal for you. Do you not comprehend?
For depravity, murder, malice, cheating, foolishness, theft, gossip, adultery, immorality, greed, envy and pride, are evil that comes out of the hearts of people and this is what truly defiles you.

Issa left Kafr Nahum for Lebanon and a woman came to him from a heathen people. She said, My Mawla, have mercy, for my daughter has a touch from Shaytan in her and she is in painful tormented from it.
Issa ignored her. The Hawariyun approached him and said, If only you would send away this woman from us for she persists in following us and shouting!
Issa replied, Surely, Allah has sent me to begin with the sheep who have gone astray from Bani Israel.
The woman came to him and bowed down before him and said, My Mawla, will you not help?
He said, The bread of the children should not be cast to those outside the covenant. She said, You are right, but the dogs can be fed from the crumbs of the tables.
Issa admired her great faith and answered her prayer and healed her daughter from the demon residing in her.

Issa left the area of Sur and passed through Sayda. Then he made a tour of the area east of the Jordan River. They brought to him a deaf and dumb person that he might heal him. Issa brought him away from the crowd that was waiting.

He put his fingers in his ears and touched his tongue with some of his saliva. Then he raised his eyes to heaven and groaned, saying, O man, be opened. His ears opened and his tongue brought forth clear speech.
Issa said, Do not tell of this to anyone. But the more he commanded them this, the more they did it saying, How wonderful are his signs and great! For the deaf are hearing and the dumb are speaking.
Issa returned to the Sea of Jalil and ascended a mountain on the eastern shore. The people came to him with their sick, crowds of them seeking healing.
They cast them at his feet and when he made the dumb speak, the lame walk and the blind see, the people were amazed and began to praise Allah.
People came to him from near and far, four thousand for three days without eating.
Issa called the Hawariyun and said to them, I am afraid that if I send the people away to their homes that they will perish on the way for they are fasting.
The Hawariyun said, It is not possible for anyone to feed all these in this place. Issa asked, How many loaves are you carrying?
They said, Seven and a few fishes. Issa took it and then made all the people sit down. He gave thanks, broke it and gave it to his helpers and they fed all the people.
When they were filled they picked up seven baskets of pieces that were leftover from those that ate.

When Issa sent the people away he sailed with his helpers to the spring of Tabigha. A group of the faqihs came to him saying, if only you would provide us a sign from Allah. But they were only testing him.
Issa replied, When the sun sets and glows like fire you predict fair weather.
When the red sky becomes dark at dawn you say that today you can expect rain.
Do you know the colors of the sky but are ignorant of the signs of Allah, O hypocrites?
You who request a sign will see in me the sign of Yunus, O corrupted ones!
Then Issa left them and sailed along with those with him to the other shore without bringing provisions. He said to his Hawariyun, Beware of the yeast of the faqihs and be on your guard against them.

They thought that he was warning them of this because they had not bought bread for themselves. But Issa discerned their hearts and said, How small is your faith! How can you say there is no bread with us? Do you still not understand?

Are your hearts hard? Do your ears not hear? Do your eyes not see? Have you forgotten the five loaves that were for the five thousand and the seven loaves for the four thousand and the number of baskets that were left over that you filled? Do you not remember?
When I tell you to avoid the yeast of the faqihs, do you think that I mean the bread that you eat? Of course not, but their hypocrisy and tradi­tions you must be cautious of.
In Bayt Sayda on the shore of the Sea they brought him a blind person to heal. He took him by his hand outside of the village and touched his eyes with his pure saliva.
Issa asked him, Can you see? He said, I see people as if they were trees walking.
Then he anointed his eyes a second time and he was seeing.
He sent him to his family, saying, Do not speak of this to anyone if they ask.
Then Issa and his helpers came to the region of the mountain of Jabal el-Sheikh, for on that day they were praying in an isolated spot.
Issa asked, What do people say about me? The Hawariyun said, They consider you to be Yahya, Elias, Irmiya the prophets or another proph­et, and differ widely concerning you.
Issa asked, But what do you say? Safwan said, Surely you are the Word of Allah the Living and his clear Nasr!
Issa said, How blessed you are, for this is information from the invisible world which I reveal to you and you are the firm rock of Allah.
For I will build my house on this rock as a true witness that will not be extinguished by Shaytan the accursed.

I have given you the keys of the Malakut of Allah. Whatever you proclaim to be haram for the people on the earth will be haram. Whatever you proclaim to be halal for them will be halal and will be so before Allah.
But I charge you to hide from the people that I am the Word so that they will not cause civil strife.

Then Issa began to make clear to them the statement, It is necessary for me to go to Bayt el-Maqdis and the sheikhs of the people will torment me and kill me and then on the third day after my death I will rise.
But Safwan took him aside to rebuke him and said, My master, Allah forbid, for you are not worthy of this destiny!
But Issa rebuked him and said, Get away from me, O Shaytan, for these desires of yours are only human desires and will turn you away from the path.
For those who seek my face, re­straining the soul from desires, and makes a jihad in my path every day are the true followers.
Whoever preserves his life will lose it and whoever loses his life in my path will preserve it on the Day of Judgment.
For if you gain the world but lose yourselves, what have you gained and with what will you be redeemed?
Those who are ashamed of my name are the losers. For when I come in the glory of Allah and the angels, I will be ashamed of them and they will be in the hereafter dis­claimed.
But there are some from among you who will not die until the Malakut of Allah will be manifest­ed with power as they witness­ it.
After several days Issa took with him from his helpers Safwan, Khalifa and Hanna and ascended the mountain Jabal el-Sheikh.
Then, in devoted prayer he manifested before their eyes into a different appearance as his clothes became white and he shined with light.
Then Musa and Elias appeared to them in glory speaking to him about his death in Bayt el-Maqdis that was a certain promise.
When the three Hawariyun awoke after drowsiness had overcome them, they saw Issa in glory and his two friends standing.

When the two left him, Safwan said to him, Our Mawla, if you will give us permission we will seek shelter on this mountain and build for you and your two friends three domes. But he said this in ignorance.
For Allah came to them in the shadow of a cloud and said, This is the Beloved with whom I am pleased with. Listen to him and obey him with acceptance.

When the Hawariyun heard this they fell down on their faces in fear. Issa drew near to them and touched them and said to them, Rise and do not be afraid. When they stood up they did not see anyone except him alone.
When they had come down from the mountain, Issa commanded them not to tell anyone about what they had seen until he had risen from the dead and was resurrected alive and visible.
The Hawariyun asked, Why do the faqihs require the return of Elias before you? Issa said, Truly he has come before me to prepare everything completely.
When Elias came to them in the form of Yahya they denied him and killed him. They will do the same thing to me in unbelief.
Issa returned and those with him to their brothers the Hawariyun and they saw a group of religious teachers arguing with them and a large crowd surrounding them.
When the crowd saw him their eyes were transfixed and they hurried to greet him. Issa asked them, What are you arguing with them about? One of them answered, seeking his help.
I take refuge for my son in you from Shaytan. For when the demon touch­es him, he throws him down, and I see him deaf, foaming, withered and gnashing.
When I asked your helpers to cast it out they were helplessly unable to.
Issa said, O you unbelieving generation. How long must I remain with you and put up with you in patience!
Then he ordered them to bring the child to himself and they did. When the demon saw him he threw him down and he fell to the ground writhing and foaming madly.
Issa asked the father, How long has this been happening to him? His father said, since he was an infant.
Often the demon casts him into a fire or into water to kill him. If you can do any­thing about it, rescue us in your mercy and give us Nasr!
Issa said, Call on your Lord sincerely and he will answer you. For the believers he will make everything possible and within easy reach.
The father of the child cried out saying, I believe, but give me Nasr and I will increase in faith and respect!
When Issa saw the people crowding around, he rebuked the dumb spirit saying, I command you to come out of the child and not to return to him. Then it came out screaming and was cast out.
It shook the child with force and cast him to the ground and he appeared to the eyes of the people as killed.
But Issa raised him up with his hand and healed him and turned him over to his father. Amaze­ment gripped the people and they said, Surely to Allah belongs all the power!

When the Hawariyun were alone with Issa they asked him, Why were we unable to cast out the demon? He said, You will not cast out this kind of demon except with prayer and fasting. But you only believe a little.
If your faith was the weight of a mustard seed, you would be able to do anything. You could move this mountain from its place completely!
They left the area of Syria and passed through Jalil.

Issa continued to hide his secret from all the people except the Hawariyun. To them he spoke of what he was to face from the people, how they will give him up, crucify and kill him and how he will rise on the third day after his death in a resurrection.
The word failed to mean anything to the Hawariyun and they did not understand it, neither did they ask him about it out of fear and re­spect.
When Issa returned with the Hawariyun to Kafr Nahum, there came to Safwan a group collecting the tax for the House of Allah. They said to him, Will your master pay the tax in compli­ance?
He said, Of course! When he returned to his house Issa responded to him saying, O Safwan, Do you think that it is the sons or the foreigners who should pay the tax as a requirement?
He said, The foreigners. Issa said, Then the sons are the best. They are free to give the tax or not. But we do not want to cause anyone to be embarrassed.

Go to the sea and cast a hook and you will catch a fish. Then open its mouth and you will find in it a coin worth four dirhams. Take it and give it to the tax collectors for me and for you as the required money.
Issa said to the Hawariyun, About what are your arguing. They remained silent, for some of them had asked one another on the way about which one is greater before Allah in rank and position.
He called them and sitting down said to them, You will not be better than others unless you humble yourselves and become to them as servants and slaves.
He then took a child and hugged him and said, You will not enter into the Umma of Allah unless you become as a child in respect and obedience.
Whoever humbles himself and becomes as a child has the highest rank and posi­tion before his Lord.
Surely the greatest among you is the least of you all. Whoever re­ceives a child in my name, it is as if he receives me and whoever does that has believed in the one who sent me as a Rasul.
Hanna said, Our Mawla, we saw a person casting out demons in your name and we forbade him for he was a strang­er.
Issa said, Do not forbid him. No person can do a sign in my name to slander me.
Whoever is not against us is for us. Whoever gives you a cup of water because you are my helpers will not lose his reward.
For whoever makes a young believer go astray, it is better a millstone be hung around his neck and he be cast into the depth of the sea and drowned.
Woe to the people for misleading for it is a reality and woe to the ones who cause people to stray from the path.
If your hand causes you to err or your foot, cut it off and if your eye causes you to err, pluck it out and cast it far away from you.

For to come before your Lord on the day of accounting with only one of the two and then enter Janna, is better than to come to him with two and then be cast into hell where neither the worms nor the fire die eternally.
Surely good salt preserves the food, but if the salt becomes stale, how will you make it salty again?
So let this salt be in you and be at peace with yourselves.
Truly we warn you not to look down on any of the young believers. For they have angels who behold the face of Allah at all times and I have come to you as a helper and a giver of Nasr.

If any of you had one hundred sheep and one went astray, would you not leave the ninety-nine sheep in the mountains and search for the one who was lost? And when he found it, would he not be overwhelmed with happi­ness?

Of course, for whenever one is guided after he has gone astray, there is more joy about it than for those who were not mislead. Likewise, Allah does not want even one of these little ones to go astray.
If your brother hurts you, go to him and privately make your rebuke. If he lis­tens, you have truly won him back and found in him a friend.
If he re­fuses you, speak to two or three others from among the brethren to confirm the word. If he does not listen to them, speak of it to all the brethren.
If he still persists in his rejection, treat him as you would treat a pagan or an ostracized unbeliever.
Whatever you pronounce haram on the earth will be haram and whatever you pronounce halal will be acceptable with Allah.

Know that if two of you meet and agree on a thing they want on earth, Allah will answer it. Wherever two or three of you brethren meet in my name, Allah will answer them. Wherever two or three brothers meet together, I will be near and answering.
Safwan drew near to him and said, O My Mawla, If my brother sins against me seven times, shall I continue to forgive him? Issa replied, Of course! Even if seven times seventy is the number.
The Malakut of Allah is like a king who wanted to have his servants give an accounting. He brought one of them before him who had a five hundred thousand dinar debt.
But since he was incapable of paying the debt, the king commanded that he should be sold along with his wife and children and all that they possessed to repay him what was required.
But he bowed down before him pleading and said, O My Mawla, if only you give me time, I will repay your money completely.
The king was sorry for him and forgave him the debt and sent him away, released and free.
When he went out he met a servant from among his companions who owed him one dinar. He demanded his money form him, grabbing him by his neck until he almost killed him by choking.
His companion said to him, falling down and pleading, If only you will be patient with me, I will repay you. He said, Never, and had him cast into jail as a lowly prisoner.
His companions were upset with what they saw and went and told their master all about what had happened in detail.

The king was furious with him and called him before him and said to him, You evil slave! Did I not forgive you all your debt because you asked me? Why did you not do to your companion what I did to you in mercy and facility?
So he commanded that he be whipped until he paid all of the debt, making of him an example.
Likewise, Allah will torture you if you do not forgive the sins of your brethren with all your heart and pardon one another in grati­tude!
Issa remained in Jalil not desiring to go to Bayt el-Maqdis for the Priests there were planning evil and murder against him .

When the Feast of Tents[^4] approached, his brethren said to him, You should leave this area and go on to Bayt el-Maqdis so that your helpers can witness your signs and treat you with even more honor.
For it is not right for anyone who has been given the signs that you have been given to remain hidden and unknown.
Issa said to his brothers, who did not believe in him, My appointed time has not yet come, but you should go to Bayt el-Maqdis on every occasion for the Hajj.
The world hates me but does not hate you, for I came to testify against the cor­ruption of the earth and it is great!
Make the Hajj yourselves to Bayt el-Maqdis. As for me, I will not wit­ness the feast openly for my appointed time has not yet come. So he did not leave Jalil.
When Issa's brothers went up to Bayt el-Maqdis for the Feast of Tents, he followed them secretly because the people were asking about him.
But the people kept quiet their secret talk for fear of the Priests. They whispered to one another saying, He is a pious man, while others said, He is a deceiver.
At the mid-point of the feast Issa came to the House of Allah teaching the people. He amazed them with his knowledge of the Book of Allah and said, From where did he get this? For he has not studied!
Issa replied, I teach you not from myself but from Allah. No one will perceive this except those who seek the will of Allah.
Whoever speaks from himself seeks only his own good. But those who seek the face of their Lord are really truthful.
Did not Musa bring you Din through his lawgiving? But you do not know it, so why are you, O my people, seeking me?
They said, Who is it that wants to kill you? Are you possessed by jinn?
Issa replied, All I have done is one sign and at this you are astonished?
Musa was not the one who ordered circum­cision for you, but it was only a command to your forefathers.
See how you circumcise people on the Sabbath seeking to please Musa. But if I heal a sick person on the Sabbath are you going to be angry?
Do not judge by outward appearance but instead judge fairly.
But the people from Bayt el-Maqdis were surprised and said, Is not this the one that our leaders want to kill? Look, he is speaking openly and they do noth­ing!
Perhaps they believe that he is the Mustafa Rasul. Yet we know this man, and no one can know when that hour will arrive.
Issa cried out saying, Truly you see me, but he who sent me as a Rasul, from whom I came and whom I know, He is true and him you do not know.

Then they began to think of stretching forth their hands to take hold of him, but as the appointed time of his Lord had not yet come, their hands were restrained, and many of the people believed in him and were guided.

Those that believed from among them said, We do not think that the Mustafa Rasul when he comes will do signs that will be greater than those done by this man. This is what they were whis­pering among themselves.
The faqihs were furious about this when they became aware of it. They sent, along with the some of the Priests, a group of guards to seek him.
Issa said, I will not be with you much longer for I am going to the one who sent me. On that day you will seek me and not find me for you will not be able.
The people were confused at his statement. To what place is he speaking of where we will not be able to find him?
Will he go to the diaspora to preach to the pagans?
On the most important day of the feast, Issa addressed the people saying at the top of his voice, O you that are thirsty, come to me and drink me!
For whoever believes in me, as the Tawrat says, there shall flow from their hearts the Sakina, which will be in them for eternity.

He said this about the Spirit, which those who trusted him were to receive. The people that heard this statement disagreed and one group said, He is a prophet. But another group claimed, He is the Mustafa Rasul who we are anticipating.
Will the Masih come from Jalil? asked others, denying it?
Surely the Masih will be from Bayt Lahm, the city of Dawud, and will be from among his descendants. This was the word of the prophets they were quoting.
Some of the people wanted to put forth their hands to apprehend him, but they did not do so because of awe.
When the guards returned the Priests asked them, Why did you not bring him? They said, No one has ever spoken the likes of the words of this one whom you seek!
The faqihs were furious with them and said, Have you also been deceived?
Have you no­ticed any one of us believing in him? May the curse of Allah be upon the common people that are ignorant of the Sharia!

But one of them contested their words, a faqih whose name was Thafir. He said, The Sharia judges no one without inves­tigating the matter. But they were mad at him and said, Perhaps you are from Jalil as he is. Look in the books. Prophets do not come from Jalil!
Then the crowd dis­persed and they went to their homes.
But Issa went up to the Mount of Olives. When it was morning he went to the house of Allah and the people came to him to learn.
The faqihs brought to him an adulterous woman and made her stand in the middle of those who were seated.
They said to him, What is the punishment for an adulteress in the law of Musa except to be stoned? But what do you say, Issa? But they were laying a trap for him.
Issa bent over and wrote on the ground without answering. When they urged him, he stood up and replied, Whoever among you is without sin, let him be the first of the stoners.
Then he continued to write on the ground in sad silence.
His word had a deep effect on them and they were overcome with shameful embarrassment.
They began to leave the place one after another with the elderly ones ahead of the younger ones.
When Issa stood up and saw no one except the woman standing in her place, he asked her, O woman, where are those who came to me accusing?
Did anyone execute the legal punishment upon you? She answered, No. Issa said, neither do I condemn. Go your way and do not be a sinner.
Issa said, I am the light of the world. Whoever follows my path, I will bring him out of darkness into the light and they will be among those that have Nasr.
The faqihs said to him, Your testimony is invalid for you are testifying to yourself. Issa replied, Surely I witness about myself the clear truth.
For I know myself, how I came and to how I am going. But you do not know.
For you surely condemn people in vain by judging merely by outward ap­pearance. As for me, I do not condemn.
But if I do judge, it is true, for Allah is with me and he is the wisest of judges.
Look, your Sharia is satis­fied with two witnesses from among yourselves. Therefore, if I testify to myself and he who sent me as a rasul testifies to me, will you believe?
The faqihs asked, Where is the one who sent you as a rasul? Issa answered, If you had known me, you would have known Allah. But you do not know him; neither do you know me.

This is how it was as Issa was teaching the people near the collection box for alms in the House of Allah. But not a single hand was laid upon him from among them as that promised time had not yet arrived.
Issa said, I am going to leave you and where I go you are not able to go.
They said, Perhaps he will kill himself so that we cannot follow him! He replied, Certainly not, for you are from the world but I am from Allah the Exalted and the Great one.
If you do not believe in me you will be dead in your sins.
They asked him, Who are you? Issa answered, Are you still asking after I have told you since I came?
How much I want to tell you, and how much will I judge, according to what I hear from him who sent me as a rasul. He is the truth of which you are ignorant!
But when the promise of your Lord comes and you have killed me, you will know who I am. You will also know that Allah is with me for I seek his desire at all times.
When Issa finished his word, many people had become believers.
Then he said to those who had believed in him, Adhere to my word and practice it and you will become my chosen helpers.
You will know the truth and by the truth you will become free.
Others among them said, We are the descendants of Ibrahim and were never in slavery.
Issa answered, Truly I say to you, whoever does evil is a slave to evil. The slave will not dwell forever in the house, but the son is the one who will dwell.
Therefore, if the son gives you freedom, you will have become free.
I know that you are the descendants of Ibrahim, but you do not listen to my word and even want to kill me.
Surely, I speak of what I have seen before Allah my Father. But you only know what you have heard from your father.
They replied, Our father is Ibrahim! Issa said, If that were true, you would have done as Ibrahim.
For when I speak the truth as I have heard it from Allah, you get angry.
See, you even seek my death. Is this what Ibrahim did?
Of course not! But you are behaving like your father.
They said, We are not children of adultery neither are we fornicators!
Our father is one Father and he is Allah. Issa replied, If Allah was your father you would have loved me,
For I have come down from Allah and was a messenger.
O my people, you are not able to bear my word neither do you understand.
For Iblis the murderer is your father who tempts you with lusts as he tempted your two forefathers from of old. You have followed him and have become dead from your sins.
Iblis never took hold of the truth for he is full of falsehood and is the father of liars.
Behold, I tell you the truth but you call me a liar. Show me one sin that I have committed! Are you able?
No one follows the Word of Allah unless he is from Allah. You are not from him and therefore you do not follow me.
They replied, When we said that you are a Samiri in whom is a touch of Shaytan, were we not correct?
Issa said, there is no touch, neither is there a demon! I honor Allah but you despise me.
I do not ask you to honor me for I have surrendered my affairs to Allah who will ask it of you and will condemn.
Know that if you keep my word and follow my path you will not die.
They replied, Now we are certain that you are crazy and possessed by Jinn!
For how can you claim that they will not die, while Ibrahim and all the prophets have died?
Issa answered, I do not honor myself so as to be among those that nullify.
But it is Allah, your God, to whom you claim a relation to.
I know him and keep his word and he honors me. But you do not know him.
If I say that I do not know him I will be, like you are, a liar.
For Ibrahim longed to see my day, and he saw it and rejoiced in the mighty sacrifice!
They replied, How have you seen Ibrahim when you have not yet reached fifty?
Issa said, I am the Eternal Word and I am before Ibrahim!
They planned to stretch forth their hands to stone him. But he turned and went out of the House of Allah and disappeared from their eyes.
While Issa was on the way he passed by a man who was born blind. The Hawari­yun said, Perhaps he has committed a sin that has brought on the blindness or maybe his parents are sinners.

Issa said, There is no power or strength except in Allah. Neither he nor his parents were the cause, but rather to magnify the one who sent me as a rasul. I do as he does. Surely this is necessary for me to do while it is still daytime for I am the light of the world.
When the night comes what can you do, for you will be incapable?
He then spat on the ground and made from it clay and placed it on his eyes. He said to him, Go to the spring of Silwan and wash in its water. He did so and became seeing.
The people that knew him previously were bewildered. A group of them said, Is this not the one we used to see sitting among the beggars?
Another group answered, Yes, while others said that he was like him. But the man him­self said, I am the one who you are bewildered about.
Astonishment came over them and they said, How did you become seeing? He began to tell them the story saying, This one named Issa is the person who made me seeing.

And as the incident happened on the Sabbath, they asked him, Where is Issa? He answered, I do not know. So they took him to their leaders and they asked him, How have you become seeing? He then informed them of the truth.
A group of them said, Surely he is breaking the laws regarding the Sabbath and therefore he is not from Allah! In this way they rejected his signs.
Another group of them said, It is impossible for a mere man to do signs like these. They were all in doubt about him and differed in opinion.
The faqihs said to the one who regained his sight, You claim that he is the one who made you see, now what do you say about him? He answered, He is surely one of the prophets!
They called him a liar and then brought his parents and asked them, Is this your son who you claim was born to you blind but now is among the seeing?
His parents answered, He himself is the certain proof.
We do not know the secret of how he regained his sight after being blind. Ask him, for he can answer you for he is of mature age.
This was the statement of those who were afraid of the Priests, that they might cast them out of the House of Allah because of their faith that Issa was the promised Masih. This is what they did.
The faqihs said to the one who had regained his sight, Ask forgiveness of Allah for your sin, for we know that this man is a sinner!
He answered them, I do not know what you know, but I am sure that from the time of my birth I was blind, and look, today, I am among the seeing!
They asked him, What did Issa do to you so that you could see? He answered, Why do you ask after I have told you before and you did not believe? Perhaps you want to become his disciples?
They were furious with him and cursed him and said, We know you only to be a follower of this one which we renounce!
We are the followers of Musa with whom Allah has spoken and this alone are we sure of.

The man was surprised and said, do you renounce the one who has made me able to see? Allah does not answer the requests of sinners when they call to him, but to the one who seeks his favor and fears him.

A person cannot make those born blind to see unless he is from Allah. The faqihs were enraged with him and issued a fatwa against him and then turned him out from their midst. They said, Do you dare to teach us while you are a sinner?
When Issa heard of it he found him and asked him, Do you believe in the Mustafa Rasul? He replied, Who is he, My Mawla, that I might be among the believers?
Issa said, You have seen him and behold he is speaking with you now! The man then fell to the ground in prostration to him and replied, I have surely believed, my master, count me as a witness!
Issa said, Surely I have come to the people as a furqan! The blind will see by their faith and the seeing will become blind by their unbelief.

The faqihs said to him, Are we then blind? Issa replied, If you were, you would not have committed a sin. But because you claim the ability to see more than other people, We shall leave you in your oppression wandering astray.
Know that those who come to the sheep pen by a way other than the gate are certainly thieves.
But the shepherd enters it by way of the gate which is opened for him. The sheep know his voice and listen to him.
He calls them by name and takes them out and leads them while they follow.
If a stranger comes to the sheep and they do not recognize his voice, they turn from him and flee.

This, therefore, is how they are described, but they did not understand it. Then Issa said to them, Know that I am the door of the sheep and that those who have come to you before me that you have not followed are certainly thieves.
Who is the thief, other than Iblis, who will destroy your houses with your own hands and shed blood. But am I anything other than your source of life and Nasr made manifest?
I am the Good Shep­herd who sacrifices his life to redeem all the sheep.
Shall we compare the shepherd to the hireling, who, when the wolf comes, is only concerned about himself and turns and flees? And when the wolf attacks, the sheep become victims and are scattered.
As I know Allah and he knows me, in like manner, I know my sheep and they know me.
I also have on the earth other sheep which I will call and they will respond.
Surely there is one Shep­herd and one flock in which they are united.
No mere person can kill me or crucify me by his own efforts. For I alone have the power to surrender myself to death and then to rise to Allah.
Disagreeing, one of the people said, Do you hear him? He is certainly crazy and possessed by jinn!
Another person said, It is not possible for one possessed by jinn to bring forth this word and to heal a man born blind, causing him to be see!
Issa crossed the Jordan River to the east as droves of people followed him seeking healing and he healed them.
Then he chose seventy from among his followers and sent them to the regions of Jordan, two by two, to go before him and make straight ways among the people for him.
He said to them, How great is the harvest and how few are those that work! Ask Allah to lead into his path those that will do a good job.
The messengers are like sheep among wolves, so take caution.
Do not carry money, food or sandals and do not waste time on the way with people fruitlessly.
When you enter a house, say, Salam Alaykum. If they return it, then the peace of Allah will be upon them. If they turn away from you, they do not want peace.
Do not change the house in which you sleep. Eat and drink what its family feeds you, for the reward of the workers is not lost.

When you come to a city and stay with its people as a guest, eat what they provide you. Heal their sick and call them to the malakut of Allah. If they reject you, leave their dust for them by shaking it from your feet as a sign.
Surely they will be worse off than the people of Lut on the day of accounting.
How unfortu­nate it will be for the people of Jalil who have witnessed my signs but who did not repent! They will have a worse destiny than the people of Sur and Sayda and a much harsher one.
If they had witnessed my signs, they certainly would have repented to Allah with a sincere repent­ance and would have bitten their hands in regret.
If Lut's people had seen the obvious miracles that I did in Kafr Nahum after them, the people of Lut would not have been burned for their sin and would not have perished in loss.
The Sadum of Lut will have a lighter punishment than Kafr Nahum on the day of accounting and better.

O messengers, if they listen to you, they will have listened to me. But if they reject you, they will have rejected me. If they will not believe in me, they will not have be­lieved in the One who sent me to the people as Nasr.
One of the faqihs came forward and asked him, What must I do to take hold of the Nasr of Allah? He was hoping to embarrass him.
Issa responded, saying, Is there not in the Tawrat an answer?
The faqih repeated the word from the Book, Love Allah with all the heart and soul and might and mind and love your brother sincerely as you love yourself.
Issa said, You have spoken the truth. Do this and you will have taken hold of the firm grip.
The faqih asked, while trying to justify himself, But who is my brother? Issa told him a parable.
There was a traveler who was going down from Bayt el-Maqdis to Ariha when thieves surrounded him, stripped him and injured him leaving him between life and death.
A priest passed by, but when he saw him he went around him and continued his walk.
Then an assistant in the House of Allah came by, but when he saw him, he did not pay him any attention and also went on by.
Then a Samiri passed by. But when he saw him, he had compassion on him and drew near and bandaged his wounds, pouring on them oil and wine.
Then he carried him on his animal to an inn to take care of him.
On the following day, the Samiri gave the owner of the khan two dinars as payment.
He said to him, Take care of him and what you spend on him over that I will repay you tomorrow.
So which of the three was more a relative to the traveler and did the good deed?
He answered, The one who showed mercy was his real brother. Issa said to the faqih, You have in the Samiri a good example!
Issa went with those fol­lowing him to the village of el-Ayza­riya. They stayed with two women who were their hosts, Mariya and her sister Martha.
Mariya sat at the feet of Issa and learned.
But Martha was busy with foods of various kinds for the guests.
Martha rebuked Mariya for sitting and said to Issa, My Mawla, will you not command her to be a help to me?
Issa replied, How many things you are worried about, O Martha! But there is a need for one thing that will not perish.
Look, Mariya has chosen it and it is hers, and Mariya is best.
It was asked Issa by one of his followers after he had finished from his salat that day, Our Mawla, We wish you would teach us a prayer as Yahya taught his followers.
Issa answered, If a guest came to stay with one of you in the middle of the night, will he send him to bed hungry or will he go to a friend and borrow three loaves of bread?

And when he asks to borrow it, will the friend give it or will he say while he is in bed, Do not bother me! The door is locked and the children are all asleep. How is it that you now ask me for bread?
Of course not! Instead, he will give him all that he asks. And if he does not give it out of love between them, he will give it just because of his honor in abundance.
Therefore, I say to you, ask and you will receive, seek and you will find, knock and the door will certainly be opened to you.
If a child asks his father for a loaf of bread will he be given a stone? Or if he asks you for a fish will you give him a snake? Or if he asks you for an egg will you give him a scorpion?
Of course not! For you, being merely human, give your children good gifts.
And who is more gracious than Allah as a Father who gives? For He will all the more give his Spirit the Sakina to whomever seeks Him.
One of the faqihs prepared for him a big luncheon. When Issa came to his house he sat at the table without washing his hands and they looked at one another in astonishment.
Issa then said, You are always purifying your vessels on the outside while your inside is filled with greed and filth.
Will you purify your vessels while ignoring yourselves in ignorance? Give alms to the poor with what is in you. That is purer for you and more righteous.
Will you give the zakat from your mint, thyme and herbs, but then obstruct the love of Allah and justice. Woe to you!
You take the places ahead of every­one else in the musallas and love to be greeted in the markets in hypocrisy.
Surely, the example of the faqihs who are hypocrites is that of effaced and crumbling gravestones. People step on them and do not realize that they are treading on impurity!
One of the faqihs confronted him and said to him, You are certainly heaping abuse upon us!

Issa said to them, Woe to you, for you are making Din difficult for people and placing burdens upon them that they do not have the strength to carry. Then you do not put forth a finger to help them carry them!
Your fathers are the ones who killed the prophets long ago and you are building for them tombs which are a witness to their unrighteous murder of the prophets and is a support of injustice!
Allah is the one who has sent among you messengers and prophets, some of whom you have mistreated and some you kill. This was foretold in the Book.
Surely, you will be held account­able for the murdered prophets, for from the time of Habil until the blood of Zakari­us whom you stoned in the House of Allah!
Woe to the faqihs who have hoarded the keys to the Malakut of Allah but who have not entered into it them­selves, neither have they brought others in because of their forbidding and hording.
When the faqihs heard this word they were filled with rage and went on with their questions hoping that perhaps he would make a mistake so the people who were plot­ting against him could accuse him.
Droves of people crowded in and were trampling on one another.
Issa said to his Hawariyun, Stay clear of hypocrisy, for it has become bread for the faqihs.
What you hide in yourselves or say in the darkness or whisper in the chambers, people will reveal openly.
Are you afraid of those who kill the body but are not able to do anything to the spirit?
Is not Allah more worthy for you to fear? For he is more than able to abandon both of them in hell.

One person asked him, My Mawla, will you command my brother to divide that which we have inherited from our father? He was amazed at him and answered, Who has placed me over you as a judge or divider?
O people, surely, greed is evil, so beware of it. For the life of a person is not in riches.
He then told a parable of the rich man whose land yielded abundantly and produced its fruit plentifully.
But his barns ran out of space because of the abun­dance. So he said, I will tear these down and build bigger ones! Then I will store up many goods and wheat!
O soul, be merry, drink and eat for a nice, long time!
But Allah scoffed at him because of his foolishness and said to him, What is this that you have gathered? For this very night I will cause you to die!
So it is with the one who has been deceived by the life of this world, whose money has not profited him with Allah and has not remained.
Say, O my beloved, be like those who are watch­ing for their master,
Work in my path and be careful, as servants who anticipate the hour of the return of their Mawla at an unexpected time, so they are not sleeping.

For if he comes to them in the middle of the night, they open up for him and he will find them awake. Those are the ones who their Lord will be pleased with and he will seat them and serve them; they are the ones who will prosper.
The thief should not come to a house whose family knows the hour of his coming and who will not be caught una­ware.
Watch for the return of your Lord and be on guard, for he alone is the knowledge of the hour and you do not know it!
The Hawariyun said, Does Our Mawla mean this parable for us, , or does he intend it for all people?
Issa then told them a parable of a servant whose Mawla left him and put him in charge of his other servants. Blessed is he if he is sincere!
But if he says, I do not think that my Mawla will return tomorrow, and then begins to beat the women and men, eating, drinking and getting drunk, then he is certainly oblivious.

So when his Mawla returned at a time when he was not expecting him, he tore him to pieces. So it will be for those who are not anticipating the return of the Masih, who do not listen to the word and who are not doing good.
And whoever rebels against his Lord, but does not know what is pleasing to him, his punishment will be light.
For according to what has been given to you will it be required of you. If you have been entrusted with much, you will be responsible for even more .
Surely, I have come to cast upon the earth a trial and I am eager for the coming of this day of mine, for it will be a great day.
Say to the hypocrites, who when they see the clouds in the west they then predict rain.
And if the wind blows upon them from the south they warn of hot weather.
Do you under­stand the face of the earth and the sky but are ignorant of the face of the truth by denying it?
Then a group came with the news of the people of Jalil that the governor Bilat had killed in the House of Allah, mingling their blood with the blood of what they were offering.

Issa replied, Do you think that they were greater sinners than yourselves, and the eighteen people that were all killed when the tower at Silwan fell upon them? Of course not! And if you do not repent you will also likewise perish.
Then Issa told them a para­ble. There was a fig tree planted in a garden but it never brought forth any fruit.
Every time its owner came wanting fruit he found it bare-branched.
So he said to his gardener, Cut it down because it is spoiling the ground and not producing figs!
But his son said to him, O father, if only you will be patient with it and I will take care of it for a while.
Then, if it still does not give fruit we will cut it down.
Relate in the account the woman who had been touched by Shaytan. He had made her hump-backed for eighteen years and she could not hardly straighten up.

When Issa saw her, while he was teaching in the musalla, he called her to himself and touched her with his hands saying to her, Be healed from what has ailed you! She then became one of those standing upright.
The Priest was furious when he saw this and said, O my people, you are transgressing the limits of the Sab­bath! You have six other days in which to seek healing.
Issa said to him, Do you, on the Sabbath, leave your animals thirsty or do you loosen their ropes and lead them to water? O you hypocrites!
Are you mad if I loosen the bonds of this woman whom Shaytan has bound and then heal her? And she is even from the family of Ibrahim!
Those that had renounced his signs were embarrassed while the people were rejoicing.
Issa then passed through the cities going up to Bayt el-Maqdis teaching the people. One man from among them asked him, O My Mawla, are there only a few who will get Nasr?
Issa answered, Make a jihad to enter through the narrow gate which many of you desire to enter but are not able.

On that day, the Lord of the House will lock the gate and you will say from behind the gate, Our Mawla, we have heard you teach in our streets and we ate and drank with you. Open for us! But he will deny you saying, Be far from me, O losers!

On that day you will see those from the eastern parts of the earth and those from the west in el-Janna reclining on cushions, calling for drink and much fruit with Ibrahim and the prophets while you are distanced!
On that day those who are last will put forward those who are advanced will be later and you will grind your teeth in anger and weep bitterly.
The faqihs ap­proached him and said to him, You had better leave us for King Antibas wants to kill you!
Issa replied, go to that fox and tell him that I am continu­ing in my way today and tomorrow, for a prophet should not be killed except in Jerusalem.
For today and tomorrow I will have a Nasr over Shaytan and healing. But on the third day will be the fulfillment of everything; it is a sure promise.
The faqihs plotted against him. One of their fanatics made a banquet for him. When he entered into his house he was confronted with someone with an internal disease.
Issa said to him, Are you going to make halal healing on the Sabbath or are you going to make it haram?

They were silent, so he took the hand of the sick one and healed him and sent him on. Then he said to them, If one of you had a child or an ox that fell into a well on the Sabbath, would you not quickly pull him out? But they continued silent, unable to speak.
Issa saw the people crowding in around the table.
So he told them a parable of a man who was invited to a party and took the head seat and was among the first.
But when one there to the table who was more important than himself, the host came to him and said to him, You must vacate your place. He was embar­rassed, but did it and became one of the last.
If he had only taken a low seat, the lord of the house would have come to him saying, My friend, move up! Then he would have increased his posi­tion and all the eyes would have praised him.
For whoever exalts himself will become lower and whoever lowers himself will be exalted.

Issa said, When you plan a banquet, do not invite your friends or your brothers, your relatives or the rich from among your neighbors who can exchange the invitation. They are the ones who have received their reward with their hands and they are not really doing good deeds.

Instead, invite to your dinner the poor, the deformed, the crippled and the blind. They are the ones who are not able to return the invitation and they will be the ones for whom you will be rewarded on the Day of Resurrec­tion for the good deeds you have done.
When a guest who was among them heard this word, he said, Blessed are the people in el-Janna, happily reclining in it !
Then Issa told them the parable of a rich man who held a great feast. He invited to it many people that they might rejoice.
When the time for dinner arrived, he sent his servant to say to them, Come, for we have prepared everything! But the people who were invited to the feast excused themselves.
One of them said, Really, the land which I have bought is worrying me and I need to see it just now, so please excuse me.
Another said, I have just purchased ten cows to plow the ground and I want to try them out right now, so please pardon me.
A third person said, I have a new bride whom I cannot bear to be away from for even one hour! I am not coming, even though you have invited me.
When he returned to his master he reported to him about them. He was angry with them and said, Return to the streets of the city and its alley ways and bring in the poor and the outcasts!
He replied to him, I have done this my master, but still there are left many seats that are prepared for those invited.
His Mawla then said to him, Go out into the byways and urgently call them so that they will fill my house and they will not hesitate!
Surely those who were invit­ed but did not respond, are those who will not taste my dinner and will not have Nasr.

Issa preached to the masses of people around him saying, Unless you follow my path with its difficulties and put me ahead of yourselves, your fathers, mothers, spouses, children, brothers and sisters, you are not my followers.

If anyone of you desires to build a tower, will he lay its foundation without a budget, not making an account of all the expenses and counting them carefully? And if he is not able to complete the building, will not the people scoff at him and laugh?
A king should not fight with ten thousand men his enemy who marches against him with twenty thousand of the same, unless he first examines the situation thoroughly making sure that he is able.
And if it appears to him that he is not capable of defeating his enemy, he will send his messenger to him seeking a truce so that they will not fight.
Likewise, you cannot follow me unless you forget yourselves and give, in my path, all that you possess.
When the seventy returned, whom he had sent into the regions of Jordan, they reported joyfully, Our Mawla, in your name we had Nasr over Shaytan!
Issa replied, Surely I saw Shaytan fall from heaven and burn up just like lightning and then was not seen.
I have sent you to the people with author­ity. If you step on a scorpion, viper and all the enemies, nothing will harm you and you will not be conquered.
But do not rejoice that I have given you obvious authority over Shaytan. Instead, rejoice that you will be given your account in your right hand!

Issa rejoiced and praised the Creator of the heavens and the earth who hid from the wise and showed the simple. He said, I have appointed you over everything. No one know the steward except the one who appointed him. No one knows Allah except the steward and those whom the steward introduces him to. He said to his helpers, Many kings and proph­ets have desired to see what you are seeing but it was not fulfilled for them. Therefore, blessed are you, O group of chosen people!

The time for the Feast of Lights came in Bayt el-Maqdis in the winter, and Issa made the porches of Sulayman a retreat for himself. The people sur­rounded him saying to him, Why do you keep us confused about yourself? If you are our Mustafa Rasul, won’t you inform us with certainty?
Issa replied, I have told you the truth but you have not believed. I came to you with the signs of Allah and did them for you and they are witnesses to me.

How are you to believe when you are not from among my sheep, those that listen to me and desire my path. I surely know them and they have a portion in heaven and no one will snatch them from me neither will they perish.
It is Allah who has given me the sheep and it is not possible for a mere human to snatch from Allah any­thing. I and Allah are one, so hear me!
They were about to stone him when he said, I did not show you anything except good signs from Allah, so why are you going to stone me for?

They replied, We are not going to kill you because of the signs you did, but because you make yourself a god besides Allah and so you blaspheme. You are only a human like us, therefore, we are going to make an example out of you!

Issa said, Is it not written in the Zabur which does not lie, that Allah compared those from among you to whom revelation was given as gods? Therefore, if I say to you that I am the Word of Allah, will you call me an infidel?
If my signs are not from Allah, do not believe in me. But since they are from Allah, they are for you to know that I have come down from him, even if you do not believe me.

They wanted to stretch forth their hands and take hold of him, but he escaped from them and returned to the Jordan valley. He stayed where Yahya used to baptize the people and many people came to him and believed.
They said, Yahya did not do a single miracle like this man has done! Surely, Yahya's word has been fulfilled in him and he was truthful.
Issa then went up to the regions of Jordan and crowds of people came to him to learn.

A group of faqihs came to him wanting to embarrass him. They asked him, Is it halal for a man to divorce his wife? He said to them, What has Musa commanded you? They answered, Musa allowed divorce and commanded, a man should give his wife a notice of divorce and then she will be separated.

He replied, Allah would not have made divorce halal for you if not for hardness in your hearts. For according to the saying of the Tawrat, Allah created the pair, the male and the female. Therefore, a man shall leave his father and his mother and become united with his wife. What Allah has joined together has become one body and no one should separate them.

When he returned to the house he said to his Hawariyun after they had questioned him, Whoever di­vorces his wife, except in the case of fornication, and then marries another has committed adultery. Or, whoever divorces her husband, and then marries another has committed adultery. And whoever marries a divorced woman - all of these commit adultery.
The statement seemed hard to them and they said, It is better for a person to be an ascetic!

Issa replied, That is not appropriate unless one is incapable of marriage or is a eunuch. And there are those who are able to control themselves by seeking the Malakut of Allah and those will be accepted.
When the faqihs saw the tax collec­tors and the fools coming to Issa to listen to him, they rebuked him saying, Who is this man whom sinners approach?
Issa replied, If one from among you had one hundred sheep and lost one of them, will he not leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness to search for the one who is gone astray?
And if he finds it, will he not lift it up on his shoulders joyfully and return with it to the house and call his friends and neighbors and rejoice?
In this manner, Allah and the angels rejoice over one who repents after having gone astray more than ninety-nine who are rightly guided.

If a woman has ten dirhams but then loses one of them, will she not light up her house and sweep it to search for it? And when she finds it, will she not call her friends to share with her in her joy over the dirham that was among the lost?
In like manner, Allah and the angels rejoice over one person who is rightly guided and repentant after going astray .
He then told them the story of a man who had two sons. His younger son told him, O father, if only you would give me my share of what we own. So he divided up between the two all that they possessed.
After several days, the younger son sold all that he owned and traveled to a distant land where he wasted his money and he was a squanderer.
When his money ran out, that land had a famine and he fell into humiliating straits.

So he worked for a man in that land who sent him into his fields to take care of his pigs. He got so hungry that he longed to eat the carob pods which the pigs ate. But nothing came his way and he had no one to feed him.

Then he came to his senses and said, Surely my father has hired labor­ers who have excess food while I am about to starve from hunger. I will return to my father and say to him, O father, take me as one of your laborers. For I am not worthy for you to consider me a son any­more. O father, I was among those who have been ignorant!

So he returned to his father. When the father saw him coming in the distance he was filled with compassion and hurried to him to receive him. He took him in his arms, hugging and kissing him. Then his son said, O father, I am not worthy to be a son to you anymore. O father, I am not worthy to be a son to you any more. O Father, I was disobedient to Allah and to you.

The father commanded his servants and they dressed his son with one of the most splendid robes. Then they put on his finger a ring and provided him with shoes. Then they brought a fattened calf and slaugh­tered it and ate it while they all rejoiced.
His father said, My son is alive, this one who was before among the dead. He had gone astray and has been rightly guided.

Meanwhile, the elder son was returning from the field. When he approached the house he heard singing and dancing and asked one of the servants what it was all about. He answered, Your brother has returned safely and your father has made a feast for him with the fattened calf.

Then he was overcome with anger and refused to enter the house. His father went out to him asking him to enter. He said to his father, I have served you for a long time and have not disobeyed your word, but you never gave me even one goat to rejoice with my friends as you are rejoicing.
But when this son of yours returns who has consumed your wealth with prostitutes, you have a feast with the fattened calf!
His father then said to him, O my son, you have all my money and you are with me at all times.
But your brother is alive after his death and has been rightly guided after having gone astray. In this we are surely glad!
Then Issa told his Hawariyun the story of a rich man who entrusted his money to a manager who was wasting it.
When he realized what was going on he called him in and asked, What is this that I hear about you? I call you to account and dismiss you for you are not worthy to be a manager!
The manager then said to himself, What am I going to do now? I have no strength to farm the ground and I am ashamed to be a beggar!
If I am to be dismissed from my responsibility, I had better do some­thing that will make the people like me and receive me.

Then he called to himself every one who owed a debt to his master. He said to one of them, How much are you indebted to him? He an­swered, One hundred measures of oil. The supervisor then said to him, Here is your contract. Now write and change it to fifty.
Then he asked another one, How much is your debt? He answered, One hundred measures of wheat. The supervisor replied, Here is your con­tract, make it eighty.
When his master learned of his treachery to him, he was impressed with his cleverness. These in this world are more clever among themselves in their dealings than those who work for the hereafter.
Therefore, work in this life so that you will find it in the hereafter with your Lord, so that you may truly gain.
Whoever is faithful with a little will be faithful with much and whoever cheats in a little, will cheat in much.

Whoever cannot be entrusted with earthly money which is vain, cannot be entrusted with what is better and more lasting. If you cannot keep a trust for its owner,, who will give you money? A slave cannot serve two masters. He will be sincere to one and hate the other. Likewise, you cannot serve money and the Lord of Mankind.
He told them a parable of a rich man who dressed in silk and was among the opulent,
and Laazar, whose body was covered with sores and who was needy.
The dogs used to come to him to lick his sores as he was cast at the gate of the rich man, hoping for the crumbs from those that ate.
When Laazar the poor man died, the angels carried him to the side of Ibrahim.
Then the rich man died and they buried him in the ground. But when he opened his eyes he was in torture in his tomb.

Then he beheld in the distance Laazar at the side of Ibra­him. He cried out, O father Ibrahim, if only you would have mercy on me and send Laazar to dip his finger in water and cool my tongue, for I am being tortured!

Ibrahim re­plied, O my son, you received your luck in the good things of earthly life and the poor man Laazar’s received his bad luck of torment. See, today you are among the inhabitants of hell and he is among the inhabitants of el-Janna.
Furthermore, there is between us and you el-Aaraf. You all are not able to pass over it to us and we are not able to come to you all.
The rich man said, O father Ibrahim, I have five brothers. If only you would send Laazar to them to warn them so that they may not face the same torment of fire and be rescued!

Ibrahim replied, But they have the Tawrat and the books of the prophets. Let them pay attention to them! The rich man then said, But father Ibrahim, if only someone would rise up from the dead and go to them, then perhaps they would be God-fearing.
Ibrahim said, Those that will not listen to Musa and the prophets, even if some­one came to them having been raised from the dead, they will not believe.
When the faqihs heard this word, and among them were those that loved money, they began to scoff at him.
Issa said to them, You make yourselves right­eous so people will see you. But Allah knows what you are inside!
Whoever is respected by people, they are the ones that are the least with Allah.
Surely the Sharia and the books of the prophets lasted among you until Yahya came preaching the Malakut of Allah and then they all rushed to him.
For it is easier for the heavens and the earth to disappear than for a dot from words of the Clear Book.

He said to his helpers, Temptations of men are inevitable, but woe to the tempters. It would be better for them to be drowned in the sea. If your brother does you evil, even if it is seven times every day, reprove him in a gentle way. And if he repents to you each time, forgive him and receive him for he is among those that repent.

They said, Our Mawla, if only you would increase our faith. Issa replied, If your faith was as the weight of a mustard seed and you said to this Sycamore tree, be uprooted and planted in the ocean and it would obey you.

If you have a hired laborer who is farming your land or taking care of your sheep, do you say to him when he returns from the field, Here is your food, now have dinner? Or do you say to him, Prepare my dinner and wait on me until I am satisfied, then I will permit you to eat. If the laborer obeys his master, does that make him distinguished?
